Après  avoir bouillie le lait, elle vend au comptant, en détail et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt, Madame Aïssitan espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge des besoins du foyer.

loans.use: Pour acheter du lait

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les neuf femmes du groupe Danaya ont  en moyenne 37 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le village de Cinzara dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté. Elles font essentiellement l’achat et la vente de laits sous toutes ses formes. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur  1er prêt solidaire.
Madame, Djeneba (1ère assise à droite sur la photo) compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 300 litres de lait frais auprès des coopératives de éleveurs de San. Après  avoir bouillie le lait, elle vend au comptant, en détail et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt, Madame  Djeneba espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 60.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge des besoins du foyer.

loans.use: Pour acheter du lait

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les neuf femmes du groupe Djiguiya ont  en moyenne 38 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le village de Cinzara dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté. Elles font essentiellement l’achat et la vente de laits sous toutes ses formes. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur  1er prêt solidaire.
Madame, Malado (2 eme assise de la droite vers la gauche) compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 150 litres de lait frais auprès des coopératives de éleveurs de San. Après  avoir bouillie le lait, elle vend au comptant, en détail et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt, Madame   Malado  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge des besoins du foyer.

loans.use: Pour acheter du lait

loans.name: Doni -Doni Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les sept femmes du groupe Doni -Doni ont  en moyenne 36 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le village de Sienso dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parenté. Elles font l’achat et la vente de poissons, de  céréales, d’habits, de condiments alimentaires, des fruits et légumes et de la restauration. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur  3 eme  prêt solidaire. Les deux prêts  précédents ont été remboursés sans aucune difficulté.
Madame, Alimata (2ème femme debout de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) est une grande restauratrice dans le village de Sienso et ses environnants. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 2 sacs de mil et un colis de condiments alimentaires à la foire de San. Après préparation de ses plats alimentaires, elle vend au comptant, en détail et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt, Madame  Alimata espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge des besoins du foyer.

loans.use: Pour acheter des ingrédients pour la restauration

loans.name: Triunfadoras Leales De Motupe Group

texts.es: La Sra. Cristina de 52 años de edad, es separa y tiene 4 hijos los cuales ya no dependen de ella. Tiene 4 años como cliente de Edaprospo y se dedica a la venta de cosméticos en su hogar. Tiene 2 años en este negocio y comenzó con la idea de mejorar sus ingresos. También se dedica al servicio de limpieza. Con su esfuerzo y trabajo ha logrado hacer crecer su negocio y aumentar su ingreso el cual lo destina al gasto de alimentación. Su plan para el futuro es construir el segundo piso de su casa y abrir un nuevo negocio. Ella usó el préstamo en la compra de más productos para su negocio ya que en estas fechas tiende a aumentar sus ventas. Cristina pertenece a la alcancía comunal “Triunfadoras Leales de Motupe”, el cual esta conformado por 7 personas y lleva más de 1 año como presidenta del grupo.

loans.use: en la compra de mercaderia.

loans.name: Adelio

texts.es:
La Sr. Adelio tiene 41 años de edad, es macatero (Vendedor ambulante), está casado con el Sra. Julia de 43 años quien trabaja de empleada domestica. Ellos tienen tres hijos, todos son estudiantes.
 Don  Adelio empezó este negocio desde muy joven, tiene experiencia de 14 años. Se inicio en Asunción y Caacupé, hasta que decidió instalarse en Caaguazú hace algunos años y continúo por cuenta propia. Con las ganancias del negocio siempre pudo mantener su hogar y quitar adelante a su familia.
El Sr. Adelio solicita este crédito para la compra de ropas de  temporada invernal, y prepararse para la semana santa y así satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.

loans.use: Comprar prendas para la venta.

loans.name: Kanou Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les cinq femmes du groupe Kanou ont  en moyenne 44 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le village de Tamaro dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parenté. Elles font l’achat et la vente de  condiments alimentaires et le commerce d’articles divers. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont adhéré  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur  1 er   prêt solidaire.
Madame, Sanata (2ème femme debout de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo) excelle dans la vente de condiments. Elle est très sollicitée dans le village de Tamaro et ses environnants. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 5 sacs d’oignons et 1 panier de   d’aubergine, 1 panier de carottes, 1 panier de poivrons et 1 panier de choux à la foire de San auprès des grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, en détail et à crédit à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt, Madame  Sanata  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et  aider son conjoint dans la prise en charge des besoins du foyer.

loans.use: Pour acheter des condiments alimentaires

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 31 años, vive en pareja con Ani,  en su casa la cual está terminando de a poco en la ciudad de Carapeguá.
Desde sus 18 años trabaja como albañil, ya que no tenía tantas oportunidades para el estudio y vio que esta profesión le podía dar un buen futuro. Los vecinos le tienen gran admiración por el espíritu servicial que posee, rescatando su honestidad y emprendedurismo.
Solicito el crédito para la compra de algunas herramientas, ya que las que posee están viejas y desgastadas y no le ayuda mucho en su trabajo. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la ayuda que esta recibiendo.

loans.use: Comprar herramientas.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
El Sr. Antonio es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 35 años de edad, es soltero y tiene un hijo pequeño que va a la escuela, el cual depende de el.
Antonio tiene una Oleria en su casa, mediante este trabajo ha podido dar a su familia todo lo que ellos necesitan para una vida digna y sin privaciones. El es una persona muy trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y progresar, y es por ello que siempre se esfuerza.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de arcilla, lo cual es el elemento fundamental de su trabajo. Esta agradecido por la ayuda que recibe de la fundación y de kiva, pues le será de mucha ayuda.

loans.use: Comprar arcilla.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El señor Miguel tiene 42 años de edad, es soltero, es de la ciudad de Villarrica.
El es taxista, y con mucho esfuerzo logró comprar para su vehículo propio. Comenta que su puesto está ubicado en un punto estratégico, lo cual le ayuda a tener buena clientela y a la vez buenos ingresos. Su meta es seguir creciendo y de esa forma poder seguir ayudando a su familia con el día a día.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de una batería para su vehículo, y también para reparaciones en general. El esta muy agradecido por la oportunidad que le esta dando la fundación y Kiva.

loans.use: Comprar una batería y mantenimiento al vehículo.

loans.name: Guido

texts.es:
El señor Guido de 30 años de edad, está casado con la Sra. Mirna, tienen un hijo, ella le ayuda en su negocio, tienen una casa de venta de celulares y accesorios bien surtidos, además el Sr Guido realiza reparaciones de celulares de todas marcas y modelos.
Guido comenzó desde muy joven vendiendo mercaderías de forma ambulante por toda la ciudad de Villarrica, hace 5 años pudo con un ahorro y créditos obtenidos abrir su negocio en un lugar bastante concurrido. Desde siempre recibe la ayuda de su esposa quien hace las ventas especialmente recargas de saldos y activaciones, mientras él repara celulares y realiza compras de Ciudad del Este.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de celulares, carcasas, estuches, cargadores, con lo que quiere tener un buen stock y de esa forma seguir manteniendo sus ventas, e incrementar sus ingresos que le permitirá seguir mejorando su nivel de vida y el de su familia.

loans.use: Comprar celulares, carcasas, estuches, cargadores, etc.

loans.name: Claudia Andrea

texts.es:
Claudia es una persona que siempre se ha caracterizado por tener un gran carisma, y es por esto que desde muy joven ha tenido claro la actividad con la cual quería trabajar en su vida. Claudia estudió atención a la primera infancia y posteriormente montó una guardería con el aval de las entidades del gobierno en la cual educa a niños y a los cuales les brinda el cuidado que no les pueden brindar los padres ya que trabajan durante todo el día. Es así como ha visto el surgimiento de su negocio a la par de que puede desempeñar la actividad que siempre ha querido. Gracias a sus conocimientos, las visitas de los entes del gobierno que le dan la garantía para trabajar han salido muy bien calificadas, y gracias a esto ha tenido la oportunidad de hacerse conocer por diferentes personas. Su guardería la tiene ubicada en una casa que se encuentra adecuada para el cuidado de los niños y debido a que esta casa ya tiene muchos años, Claudia busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a realizar arreglos al techo de la casa donde tiene su guardería para poder ofrecer mayor calidad en su servicio y brindar tranquilidad en su oficio.

De esta manera podrá tener un hogar para el cuidado de los niños con mayor seguridad y brindará mayor tranquilidad a los padres de estos niños. Además, así podrá ser más atractiva la guardería para los clientes y podrá seguir teniéndola como fuente de ingresos para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar.

loans.use: Realizar arreglos al techo de la casa donde tiene su guardería para poder ofrecer mayor calidad en su servicio y brindar tranquilidad en su oficio.

loans.name: Mayra Rosa

texts.es: Mayra Rosa es una emprendedora que ha venido trabajando con Fundación León 2000, en el crédito anterior todo lo invirtió en el negocio en la compra de materiales para la producción del pan. La emprendedora nos expresa que con el apoyo que se le ha brindado ha aumentado la producción y sus clientes. Actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para la comprar productos como harina, huevos, manteca, levadura, mantequilla, vainilla entre otros productos.

loans.use: comprar harina, huevos, manteca, levadura, mantequilla, vainilla entre otros productos.

loans.name: Ada Luz

texts.es: Ada Luz de 53 años de edad vive en un tradicional barrio de la ciudad con su esposo y tiene una hija de 28 años. Ella vende medicamentos en un local arrendado, ubicado  frente al hospital de la ciudad; su negocio inició hace 15 años, con recursos propios provenientes de su trabajo como instrumentadora, para apoyar el bienestar de su familia, contribuyendo con los gastos del hogar. La ubicación de su negocio frente a un hospital es oportunidad de incrementar sus ventas cada vez más y aumentar sus utilidades y su capital de trabajo para comprar las medicinas que se requieren, son su mayor desafío porque se torna insuficiente ante su propósito de ventas.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con el cual comprará medicina que tiene mayor rotación en su farmacia, con el fin de aumentar el volumen de sus ventas y mantener  la farmacia siempre bien surtida. Su sueño mas adelante es tener una casa propia y en esto enfoca sus esfuerzos para lograr un mañana mas tranquilo.

loans.use: comprará medicina que tiene mayor rotación en su farmacia

loans.name: John Alvaro

texts.es:
John es una persona muy trabajadora que siempre ha salido adelante a pesar de las adversidades que le ha presentado la vida y ha logrado sacar a su hijo adelante brindándole una buena educación. Desde hace aproximadamente 20 años desempeña la actividad de la fabricación de calzado, gracias a que trabajó para una empresa durante mucho tiempo y adquirió el conocimiento. Cuando se vio en la necesidad de generar mayores ingresos, dado a que es padre soltero cabeza de familia de su hijo de 8 años, John decidió independizarse y montar su propio negocio con el cual pudiera generar ingresos adicionales al de su trabajo como empleado y poder sacar adelante a su hijo. En un principio en su taller de fabricación de zapatos vendía por encargos pocas cantidades, pero con el tiempo estas cantidades fueron aumentando hasta el punto en que hoy se dedica por completo a su taller y esta ha sido su principal fuente de ingresos para el hogar. Gracias a su taller de fabricación de zapatos ha logrado sacar a su hijo adelante y le ha logrado brindar una buena educación. Con la finalidad de seguir creciendo en su taller, ya que ha tenido muy buenos pedidos, John busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de comprar insumos y materias primas para la fabricación de su calzado y comprar herramientas de trabajo con los cuales pueda aumentar su capacidad productiva.

De esta manera su taller seguirá creciendo y podrá seguir teniendo una buena fuente de ingresos para su hogar con el cual su hijo podrá seguir estudiando y poco a poco cumplir su sueño de sacar adelante a su hijo brindándole una buena educación.

loans.use: Comprar insumos y materias primas para la fabricación de su calzado y comprar herramientas de trabajo con los cuales pueda aumentar su capacidad productiva.

loans.name: Sol Marina

texts.es: Sol con su anterior credikiva compró de contado y en mayor volumen  medicinas naturales, ropa, cosméticos, calzado y variedades; ella  aprovechó  las fechas especiales como día de la secretaria y día de la madre, comercialmente le fue muy bien, obtuvo  sus mejores  ingresos en cuanto se incrementaron sus ventas. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva y está haciéndolo en la misma temporada que el anterior; ahora responderá a pedidos de sus clientes y ajustará sus compras a sus solicitudes de ropa cosméticos, calzado y variedades. Con ello una vez mas aumentará su capital de trabajo y cada día crecerá un poco más su negocio; esto es justamente lo que garantiza el éxito de su inversión. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva el es siguiente: Muchos agradecimientos a Kiva y a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, deseo que me sigan apoyando, para continuar progresando personal, familiar y profesionalmente.”

loans.use: Comprará ropa cosméticos, calzado y variedades

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es: Luis con su credikiva anterior compró en mayor cantidad sus víveres de mayor rotación como aceites, pastas, leche en polvo, café detergente etc. El agradece y pide a sus  financiadores lo siguiente: “Sigan apoyando a este programa ya que estamos logrando objetivos pendientes de realizar. “ En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva con el que comprará un mayor número de artículos de la canasta familiar que están siendo ofrecidos por sus proveedores con descuentos al ser comprados en mayor volumen; con ello tendrá un buen inventario y muy elegantemente surtida su tienda, ofreciendo a su clientela diversidad de artículos, con los que satisfacer sus necesidades y esto es justamente lo que garantiza el éxito de su inversión.

loans.use: un mayor número de artículos de la canasta familiar

loans.name: Flor

texts.es: Flor tiene 66 años de edad, es una mujer casada que tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 28 a 40 años. Ella se dedica a la venta de desayunos y almuerzos. En su negocio en las horas de la mañana vende productos fritos como arepas, empanadas  de queso de carne y de pollo y carimañolas elaboradas con yuca amasada que rellena con productos cárnicos. También al medio día vende almuerzos que prepara para clientes fijos y ocasionales. Su negocio funciona en la sala de su casa desde hace más de 12 años, e inició con ahorros propios, cuando tuvo como propósito aumentar los ingresos familiares y apoyar los gastos del hogar, que en ese momento estaban a cargo de su esposo, dedicado al comercio. Su meta es tener su restaurante en un lugar diferente al de su propia vivienda, buscando un mayor sosiego, porque no tiene límite entre su trabajo y su descanso hogareño y su trabajo se extiende mucho más en tiempo, debido a que es muy conocida en el sector. Su mayor desafío es tener un espacio amplio para desarrollar su negocio y el no tener capital suficiente para lograrlo. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará insumos en mayor cantidad para ganar descuentos, hará mantenimiento a sus herramientas y equipos de trabajo  y con ello empezará el crecimiento empresarial tan anhelado por Flor.

loans.use: comprará insumos para preparar sus alimentos en mayor cantidad, para ganar descuentos

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
As a child, Chris witnessed his father teach himself to DJ. As he grew, Chris learned to DJ by helping his father during events. Since then, Chris, 27, has learned new tricks, but credits most of what he knows to his father’s guidance. 

For the past 10 years, he’s worked as a DJ, but as of March 2012, he completed his first year as an entrepreneur with his San Antonio business: I.C.A.D.J. Entertainment. At some point, Chris hopes to hire more DJs, but at the moment, he is focused on doing his own work. 

Aside from being a DJ, Chris works for Time Warner, sells travel packages for another company and, on his free time, assists other DJs.  He said not being in one field of work helps him be a better person. He decided to become an entrepreneur after he found the opportunity for monetary growth and use his strength of communication to his advantage.

“The unique thing about me, I don’t require multiple DJs.” he said. With him as the only DJ, Chris said, there is more room for personal time with the client or coordinator. “It allows me to give better value in price,” Chris said adding, “I deliver value on all events.” 

During events, Chris includes a variety of lights to give a club vibe. Chris said it doesn’t matter how many 
lights a DJ has, what’s important is what they do with them. 
Prior to contacting ACCION Texas Inc., Chris discussed the possibilities of applying for a loan at Security Service Federal Credit Union. Afterwards, a SSFCU employee approached him and introduced ACCION to Chris. 
Chris will use the loan to upgrade his equipment and repair his vehicle that transports him to events. His list includes a pair of 18” Harbinger speakers for better sound, lights, some of which are still working but are old, he said; he is also interested in purchasing laser lights. The rest of the loan will contribute to online marketing with the North Chamber of Commerce. 
Chris said he is excited and looks forward to make a good use of the loan and turn it into something better. “My goal is to improve annually,” he said. “This is a big step for me.”

loans.use: To update equipment and repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Las Tinyarinas Group

texts.es:
La Srta. EDITH CONSUELO de 22 años de edad soltera, actualmente es socia en la alcancía comunal, siempre carismática y emprendedora del grupo “LAS TINYARINAS” grupo conformado por 07 personas. 
EDITH CONSUELO se dedica a la venta cosméticos de belleza productos EVON que vende en el local de su casa, ya que ella se esmera en aperturas otros nuevos locales de ventas
El préstamo solicito para incrementar su capital de trabajo y comprar accesorios de cosméticos, perfumes, etc. 
Sus objetivos para el futuro es aperturar su salón de belleza. Ella se ubicada la segunda persona  lado derecha viste con polo color celeste casaca color negro.

loans.use: VENTA DE COSMETICOS DE BELLEZA

loans.name: Angélica

texts.es: Angélica de 34 años de edad vive en el municipio de Soledad y tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 9 y 12 años. Ella se dedica al comercio mediante una miscelánea ubicada en su casa donde vende artículos de misceláneas, como accesorios femeninos, de hogar y ofrece el servicio de telecomunicaciones mediante celulares, vendiendo minutos, productos alimenticios y ofrece el servicio de impresiones. Su vida de negocio inició porque no tenía un trabajo formal y fueron muchas las hojas de vida que llevara a empresas, donde no pudo ingresar para obtener un empleo formal y de calidad. Con la responsabilidad de sus dos hijos,  su inquilino de un local de su propiedad, le insinuó que emprendiera su propio negocio y esto fue hace 4 años, desde los cuales ha ido poco a poco creciendo, compró dos vitrinas, un computador, impresora y cada día que pasa resulta desafiante atender  la clientela, con la infraestructura que hoy cuenta. Su mercado le señala la necesidad de tener una impresora mas, una fotocopiadora para ofrecer un nuevo servicio y mantener las vitrinas bien surtidas. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el que comprará una fotocopiadora y mercancía variada con la cual surtirá sus vitrinas. La inversión planea ser exitosa porque responde a la demanda y la hace en el marco de su experiencia como comerciante. Su sueño más adelante es tener un café internet, con la infraestructura necesaria para que sus clientes se sientan en un ambiente confortable,  mientras satisfacen sus necesidades de estos servicios tan modernos.

loans.use: comprará una fotocopiadora y mercancía variada con la cual surtirá sus vitrinas

loans.name: Rosa Margarita

texts.es:
Rosa ha tenido que superar grandes adversidades en su vida, para lo cual sus ganas de trabajar han sido fundamentales. Rosa es una madre soltera cabeza de familia de sus 7 hijos desde hace muchos años, pues se separó de su esposo y este los abandonó sin hacer alguna contribución económica para su sostenimiento. Debido a la necesidad de generar sus ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hogar, montó una venta de helados con la cual podía tener unos buenos ingresos y la cual le brindó durante un largo tiempo la posibilidad de tener una mejor calidad de vida en su hogar. Ahora que es más conocida en su sector y que sus clientes la visitan constantemente, Rosa quiere incursionar en un negocio paralelo a este con el cual genere ingresos extras, el cual es una venta de prendas de vestir a través de catálogos y es por esto que busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de prendas de vestir para iniciar su negocio y tener la mercancía para ofrecer a sus clientes.

De esta manera tendrá ingresos superiores con los cuales su familia podrá acceder a una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas. Además, podrá poco a poco ir cumpliendo su sueño de sacar sus hijos adelante y brindarles todo lo que necesitan.

loans.use: Compra de prendas de vestir para iniciar su negocio y tener la mercancía para ofrecer a sus clientes.

loans.name: Alba

texts.es: Alba está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva porque necesita comprar tanques plásticos para comercializarlos y aumentar su capital de trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Con su anterior credikiva logró comprar tambores plásticos y los comercializó en las ciudades de Montería, Sincelejo y Magangúe, lugares también ubicados en la costa  Caribe de Colombia. Con ellos les fue muy bien porque rotó rápidamente su capital y logró un ligero aumento en sus ventas. En su mensaje a los financiadores dice lo siguiente: “Muy agradecida con esas personas que nos han ayudado para seguir adelante en nuestros negocios y continúen con esta bonita labor. “.

loans.use: comprar tanques plásticos para comercializarlos

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es: Rosa tiene un negocio de variedades como ropa, calzado, perfumes, desodorantes, sombrillas entre otros artículos y también vende queso y suero costeño, que constituyen sus ingresos adicionales. Rosa inició vendiendo pocas mercancías y con el transcurrir del tiempo ha ido creciendo y agregando opciones como la venta de suero y queso que ofrece a su ya fiel clientela. Su mercado principal lo conforman sus vecinos del barrio donde habita y de otros barrios al sur de la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias, donde es muy conocida. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual comprará ropa y calzado especialmente, preparándose para el día de las madres, mes en el  cual hay una inclinación de sus ventas pues sus clientes conocen de sus productos y están a la espera de su oferta y de los muchos pedidos que han hecho a Rosa. Esta es la razón por la cual su inversión se postula como exitosa, pues se basa en su habitual demanda y en los pedidos puntuales de sus más fieles clientes, lo cual augura una rotación muy rápida de sus inventarios y un ligero aumento de sus utilidades. Su meta es continuar el crecimiento de su negocio y no hay  una mejor forma de hacerlo,  si no es con su trabajo persistente y disciplina de inversión. Su sueño es lograr un futuro exitoso para su hijo, que siempre se mantenga sano y lograr el  máximo crecimiento de su microempresa comercial.

loans.use: comprará ropa y calzado especialmente

loans.name: Sirley Veronica

texts.es:
Sirley es una joven emprendedora que ha visto como sus dificultades económicas las puede superar con un gran esfuerzo. Tiene una hija de 1 año de edad y debido a que su esposo no genera los ingresos suficientes para el sostenimiento de todos los gastos de su hogar, decidió montar su propio negocio con el cual pudiera contribuir económicamente para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar. Fue así como montó una venta de obleas y de helado a las afueras de su casa la cual ha venido trabajando desde hace aproximadamente 1 año y con la cual genera ingresos extras para su hogar. El negocio ha tenido que superar grandes dificultades ya que hace poco tiempo su hija se enfermó y Sirley no pudo abrirlo durante unos días, con lo cual sus ingresos disminuyeron notablemente y hasta ahora se ha venido recuperando de esta adversidad. Gracias a que se esfuerza mucho en este negocio, ha logrado captar una gran cantidad de clientes para este, y es por eso que ahora Sirley busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de comprar insumos para la preparación de sus obleas y la venta de helados, y seguir ofreciendo buenos productos a sus clientes.

De esta manera podrá seguir progresando con su familia y seguir ofreciendo a su hija una buena calidad de vida. Además, Sirley sueña que su negocio pueda trasladarlo a un lugar mejor, ya que lo atiende a las afueras de su casa.

loans.use: Comprar insumos para la preparación de sus obleas y la venta de helados, y seguir ofreciendo buenos productos a sus clientes.

loans.name: Buenas Esperanza Group

texts.es:
La señora Santos Martina es casada, tiene 48 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 6 hijos 3 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la confección de blusas y faldas, inició este negocio con poco capital y el apoyo de su hijo, hasta el momentos lleva 8 años de experiencia,  cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al comercio de materiales de construcción de viviendas.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizar´`a para la compra de telas licra de varios colores, ya que espera en el futuro contar con operarios. Las demás integrantes se dedica a la confección de blusas y faldas, venta de delantales, venta de servilletas y a la crianza de animales.

loans.use: Compra tela licra

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Maria De Los Ángeles es una emprendedora que se le brindo financiamiento para comprar productos para la pulpería y ofrecerle a sus clientes. Esta emprendedora ya ha trabajado con Fundación León 2000 en el crédito otorgado ha demostrado ser responsable pero sobre todo deseo de superación en el negocio y en lo personal. Actualmente esta solicitando financiamiento para la compra de productos como granos básicos, detergentes, golosinas, pan, sopas, huevos, tan, entre otros productos.

loans.use: comprar granos básicos, detergentes, golosinas, pan, sopas, huevos, tan, entre otros productos.

loans.name: Jessica Fernanda

texts.es:
La Señora Jessica es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Luchadoras, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca capital de la provincia del Azuay, es reconocida como la "Atenas del Ecuador" y la ciudad cultural del país. Su centro histórico es el más grande y el mejor conservado del país,  podemos encontrar muchas artesanías como: tejidos, bordados, cerámica, orfebrería, platería y sombreros de paja toquilla.

La Señora. Jessica tiene 21 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido un hijo de nueve meses de edad. Su esposo labora prestando sus servicios como guardia de seguridad, la casa en la que habitan es arrendada.

La Señora. Jessica es una profesional en la costura ya que ha estudiado y hace un año se encuentra ejerciendo su profesión, labora de lunes a viernes todo el día, hace 6 meses también tiene su negocio propio, instaló una tienda en la que trabajan de domingo a domingo desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 11 de la noche, en el tiempo que se encuentra trabajando su madre es quien atiende la tienda.

Este es el primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su suegra. Su crédito lo va a invertir comprando productos de primera necesidad para surtir su tienda.

Su meta es comprarse un vehículo.

loans.use: Comprar productos de primera necesidad.

loans.name: Mónica Mercedes

texts.es:
La Señora. Mónica es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Luchadoras, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca capital de la provincia del Azuay, es reconocida como la "Atenas del Ecuador" y la ciudad cultural del país. Su centro histórico es el más grande y el mejor conservado del país, podemos encontrar muchas artesanías como: tejidos, bordados, cerámica, orfebrería, platería y sombreros de paja toquilla.

Doña Mónica tiene de 40 años, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 6 hijos, de los cuales 2 son casados y viven independientes, uno de sus hijos trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, dos de sus hijos están en el colegio y su último hijo estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como guardia de seguridad, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

La Señora. Mónica es comerciante y se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de varias marcas como Avon y Esika, labora sin horario fijo y se dedica a este negocio desde hace 7 años. También hace 3 meses comenzó a trabajar de empleada domestica.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 7 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia.

loans.use: Comprar cosméticos.

loans.name: Griselda

texts.es: La cliente, Griselda, es una señora de 25 años de edad, tiene 1 hijo dependiente y es madre soltera, la cliente se dedica a la producción de la leche cruda, en donde actualmente tiene 3 cabezas de ganado lechero en producción, y la leche que produce entrega a las personas del lugar por donde ella vive, actualmente la cliente vive por la zona sur de la ciudad de Cochabamba, aproximadamente a 10 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba, la casa donde vive la cliente es propia y de su familia, la cliente vive con su hijo, el destino del nuevo crédito de la institución es para la compra de cabeza de ganado lechero, para aumentar sus ingresos  por la venta de la leche, y de alguna u otra manera podrá satisfacer sus necesidades que tiene en su domicilio, es por lo cual reflejamos esta pequeña historia de la cliente, para el conocimiento de todos ustedes.

loans.use: Compra de ganado lechero

loans.name: Sandra Maricela

texts.es:
La Sra. Sandra es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Luchadoras, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca capital de la provincia del Azuay, es reconocida como la "Atenas del Ecuador" y la ciudad cultural del país. Su centro histórico es el más grande y el mejor conservado del país, podemos encontrar muchas artesanías como: tejidos, bordados, cerámica, orfebrería, platería y sombreros de paja toquilla.

Doña Sandra tiene 41 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 17, 12 y 2 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como guardia de seguridad, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

La Señora. Sandra se encuentra muy bien en la salud al igual que todos los miembros de su familia.
Ella se dedica a la atención de su tienda  y a las manualidades, realiza todo tipo de tejidos, se dedica a estas actividades porque le gusta y tiene todo el tiempo para estar pendiente de su familia.
 
El dinero de su crédito anterior lo invirtió comprando víveres para su tienda y los pagos del crédito los realizo sin ningún problema. Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de vitrinas y  productos de primera necesidad para su tienda La banca comunal le gusta por el compañerismo que comparten dentro del grupo y la solidaridad, también porque los créditos son rápidos dándoles la oportunidad de crecer en su negocio.
 
Su meta es crecer más en su negocio.

loans.use: Comprar unas vitrinas y productos de primera necesidad.

loans.name: Manuel Ernesto

texts.es: Manuel Ernesto es un emprendedor que ha luchado por salir adelante y tener su propia herramienta de trabaja para brindarle a su familia lo mejor, este emprendedor  ya ha venido trabajando con Fundación León 2000, en el cual en el crédito anterior lo utilizo en el negocio en la compra de productos nos expresa el emprendedor que gracias al apoyo ha aumentado su inversión en la compra de productos para ofrecerle a sus clientes. Actualmente el emprendedor está solicitando financiamiento para la compra de productos como granos básicos, tan pan, huevos, detergente, pasta de diente entre otros productos.

loans.use: comprar granos básicos, tan pan, huevos, detergente, pasta de diente entre otros productos.

loans.name: Fuerza Y Valor Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Fuerza Y Valor” es un nuevo grupo que está conformado por 07 socios, siendo la gran mayoría vecinos de la zona. Gladys tiene 40 años de edad, es separada con 02 hijos independientes.  Hace más de 25 años que Gladys se dedica a la venta ambulatoria de verduras, como segunda actividad se dedica a la crianza de cerdos. Gladys es una mujer trabajadora, pues gracias a su trabajo y dedicación a podido mejorar su vivienda  y mantener su negocio.  Su mayor deseo es de terminar de construir su vivienda. A  fin de seguir creciendo en su negocio solicito el crédito para comprar verduras y comida balanceada para sus cerdos. La nueva Alcancía Comunal “Fuerza Y VAlor” agradecen el crédito brindado.

loans.use: Para la compra de verduras y comida balanceada.

loans.name: Corazón De Jesús  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Corazón de Jesús está formado por 12 socias y 2 socios quienes laboran en la agricultura, cría de animales y el comercio o ejerciendo diferentes actividades en la ciudad de Cuenca, sus trabajos les permiten ser independientes económicamente solventando sus gastos y los de sus hogares,  así pueden sacar adelante a sus familias, se caracterizan por ser amables y gentiles. Viven por la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, lugar que tiene hermosos paisajes, su gente es amable y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Ana María, tiene 42 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 25, 23, 21 y 12 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja  para sus gastos personales, sus dos hijos siguientes son casados y viven independientes, su último hijo está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora prestando sus servicios, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.
 
La Señora. Ana María desde muy joven labora medio día como empleada domestica y hace 5 años se dedica a la atención de su tienda en donde labora de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo. También cría cerdos, pollos y cuyes los que vende en su comunidad.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 7 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir comprando productos de primera necesidad para surtir  su tienda.

Su mea es  agrandar su negocio.

En esta ocasión en la foto nos acompaña la mamá de una de las socias, la misma que se encuentra sentada en la primera fila con falda azul, blusa celeste y saco blanco.

loans.use: Comprar productos de primera necesidad.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Maria De Los Ángeles ya ha trabajado con Fundación león 2000, en el cual la emprendedora ha aprovechado el financiamiento en aumentar su productos para ofrecerle a sus clientes, durante el financiamiento que se le brindo ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y con un record crediticio intachable, actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para comprar leña y cerdos y ofrecerles a sus clientes.

loans.use: comprar leña y cerdos y ofrecerles a sus clientes.

loans.name: Choijinhorloo

texts.en: Choijinhorloo is a 46 years old man who lives with his wife and 2 children in a suburban area of the capital city of Mongolia. His wife is employed and their daughters are in college and high school. He has been making wooden products since 1992. He has an experience of 20 years on the field. The workplace is at his home, outside the dooryard. The products he supplies include table, chair, sofa and other types of furnitures. Choijinhorloo is a hardworking and talented carpenter who says that "I would like to improve the business activity by purchasing the necessary materials like woods, nails and applicators in large quantities, so that I could produce more products at once to expand the volume". The total amount he is requesting is 2,000,000 MNT to purchase the woods, nails and other materials for the business.

loans.use: To purchase the woods, nails and other materials

loans.name: Primero De Abril  (Montecristi) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Primero De Abril se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional, lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla. Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse hace bastante tiempo atrás y formar este Banco Comunal que les ha servido de mucho, ellos Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio, servicios, venta de comidas entre otras actividades.

En este lugar vive es Señor Walter, tiene 33 años de edad, está casado y fruto de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos 17, 16, 14 y 11 años de edad, todos  estudian, los mayores  en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposa es ama de casa.
 
Él se dedica a la venta de  frutas y verduras, trabaja todos los días desde las  05h00 hasta las 14h00, él se desplaza en su carro desde la madrugada hasta el mercado mayorista en Portoviejo para comprar los productos para poder ofrecerles a sus clientes, luego recorre la ciudad y ciertos sitios cercanos vendiendo sus productos, tiene 16 años que se dedica a esta actividad y gracias a Dios le da lo necesario para poder vivir.

Este crédito es para comprar frutas y legumbres. Lleva cinco ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son de gran ayuda para financiar su negocio.

Su sueño es comprar otro carro ya que el que tiene está un poco deteriorado.

loans.use: Comprar frutas y legumbres.

loans.name: Enhmanlai

texts.en: Enhmanlai is a 24 years old man who lives with his parents and brother in the capital city of Mongolia. He started a printing business 2 years ago. The business has been successful because there was a big demand for it. Instead going to the center of the city, the local people now asks for his business. He has been meeting the needs of customers and it has been appreciated. First, he started with the some old equipment and now he is planning to replace those which have been used long. Enhmanlai is a bright young man who says that "I would like to expand the business activity by purchasing the latest equipment for my business, so that I could provide the best service to the customers and increase my income". The total amount he is requesting is 2,500,000 MNT to buy necessary equipment for the printing shop.

loans.use: To buy necessary equipment for the printing shop

loans.name: Dulam

texts.en: Dulam is a 32 years old woman who lives with her husband and 3 children in a suburban area of the capital city of Mongolia. 2 of her children go to secondary schools and the youngest one stays at home. She has been running meat retails business since 2003 with her husband. She goes to the countryside and brings the supplies from the herders. She has been trading meats at the local trade center. This has been the only income source for her and her family. Dulam is a bright woman who says that "I would like to improve the business activity by purchasing the meats from a wholesale at once, so that I could save on transportation expenses and save for my children's future. I wish to improve the household livelihood". The total amount she is requesting is 2,500,000 MNT to buy more meats from the herder families.

loans.use: To buy more meats from the herder

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en: Oyunchimeg is a 41 years old woman who lives with her husband and 2 children in a suburban area of the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband is employed. The children go to college and high school. She started a construction materials trading business in 2004. She trades products at the bazaar, which is often crowded and has many customers. She has a rental counter at a bazaar, but she is planning to develop the business by buying her own shop counter. Oyunchimeg is an honest and bright woman who says that "I would like to expand the business activity by buying the construction materials in large amounts from China so that I could save more money and save it for my daughters' college tuition fees". The total amount she is requesting is 2,000,000 MNT to buy the construction materials to sell.

loans.use: To buy the construction materials to sell

loans.name: Bundhorol

texts.en: Bundhorol is a 32 years old woman who lives with her husband and 2 children in Uvurhangai province of Central Mongolia. Her husband is employed and the oldest child studies at a secondary school. She has started running public catering business in 2004, which is located on near a road tourists often travel through. She has built the winter house for the business so that she could also run the business in wintertime. Now she plans to expand the building for food store. She has recognized that the location she runs her business is quite well-located and has lots domestic and foreign customers travel through. Bundhorol is an active woman who says that "I would like to expand the business activity by extending the building to open a food store, so that I could develop the business and increase the income". The total amount she is requesting is 1,500,000 MNT to purchase more construction materials to continue build her food store.

loans.use: To purchase more construction materials to continue build her food store

loans.name: Thay

texts.en:
Thay is 43 years old and an industrious mother who raises hogs to fatten for sale. She has been doing it for 5 years. She has two single children and two married children. Presently her single daughters work as garment workers in various workplaces. Mostly they help the family with part of their salary sending home monthly.

Thay would like to renovate her present house and cover the roof with tiles. So she needs additional capital to achieve her dream of building a good shelter and pay for the construction fees. She hopes that she can expand her hog raising business and better her living someday.

loans.use: to renovate her present house and cover the roof with tiles.

loans.name: Kam

texts.en:
Kam, 60, is married, resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for over ten years, earning approximately USD 5 per day. Her husband runs the business of selling knives and axes and earns about USD 5 per day. Her children are employed in garment factory. They earn about USD 6 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s economy, Kam requests a loan of USD 600 to raise capital in her business to purchase more groceries to sell. This purchase would enable her to make more profit to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to use the further profit to expand her business and rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more comfortable for her family’s living.

loans.use: to raise capital in her business to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Sum

texts.en: Sum, 42, is married with five single children. She lives with family in Baray district of Kompong Tom province, where she was born and grew up in family farm. She gets involved in pig raising business. She fattens her pigs for both slaughter and offspring. She has been in this business for 8 years. Recently, Sum’s family doesn’t own any vehicle for traveling yet. For that reason, Sum is asking for a loan to purchase a used motorcycle for the entirely family’s use. It’ll provide a good transportation for her family to get anywhere they wish to without paying for any taxi service as in the previous time

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle for the entirely family’s use.

loans.name: Nhak

texts.en:
Nhak is 45, married and has four children. Together, they live happily in a small village of Baray district, where the common business is agriculture. Due to the great expenses, Nhak decided to engage in a hog-raising business to help her husband, who sells the firewood for earn income to satisfy her basic necessities. She has been in this type of business for almost 8 years and normally generates an average of 1.50USD per day.

Nhak aims to obtain a quality of life through the requested fund and her effort. So she has applied for a loan to purchase a good motorcycle for household and business use purpose. For the future, she hopes to make improvement in her business and find better ways to build a comfortable living.

loans.use: to purchase a good motorcycle for household and business use purpose.

loans.name: Ky

texts.en:
Ky, 43, is a farmer living in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. She is married and has 4 children, 3 of whom attend school. Ky has started working in rice farming since she was an adult living with her parents. It is the family’s owned business and was handed down from one generation to another. She is hardworking and works honestly in performing her daily tasks at the rice field. But most of the time, her spouse always works with her to achieve their goal.

Due to inadequate capital, Ky is seeking for a loan through HKL to repair her house partially, especially a broken ones that are in need to be fixed on time. She is very happy for the granted fund to renovate her house. She hopes that to have a comfortable shelter, which provides satisfaction to the family through using this loan.

loans.use: to repair her house partially.

loans.name: Lam

texts.en:
Lam is 62 years old, a resident who lives in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham. She owns and manages a rice farming business, from which the family’s main income is generated to meet their daily needs. She has worked in this business for more than 30 years. She has a life partner who is in the same business and has two married children and one single child who presently lives with her under the same roof.

Due to insufficient fund to cover over her cultivation expenses, Lam is taking out a loan from HKL and Kiva to pay for plowing fee and land cultivation. Lam believes that she will be able to drive her business toward a success through using this loan from our kind lenders.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fee and land cultivation.

loans.name: Kâng

texts.en:
Kâng is a 48-year-old married woman who has been residing in Prey Chor district. She has been blessed with 4 single children, one of whom is already engaged to be married soon in the coming months. Kâng raises her family with the income generated from rice farming business. She has been in this business for ages. She thanks to her business that provides her family a suitable living condition.

Kâng would like to borrow her first loan from HKL to supplement her capital for the preparation of a wedding party of her child. She is very happy and appreciated for the given fund.

loans.use: to supplement her capital for the preparation of a wedding party of her child.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Being a responsible mother, Chan, is engaged in fish selling business to generate income for the family. She sells in a local market, where there are many of her customers who prefer to buy her fish because of her honesty and friendliness. She typically earns approximately 3.00USD per day through this business.

To improve her living status, Chan is asking for a loan of 1,100USD to hire a plantation for growing some kinds of crops. She hopes that she is able to make her business profitable through the great help from our lenders.

loans.use: to hire a plantation for growing some kinds of crops.

loans.name: Son

texts.en:
Son is 47 years old, a loving other who has been living in Dongkor commune. She takes care of her children and manages all household things, while her husband works at the construction field to provide as daily income. Son has two single children and one married child, all of whom are employed and have independent living.

With the requested fund, Son will use it to buy a motorcycle to provide transportation for the family. Son told us that this loan use will help her reduce some expenses on transportation fees. She hopes that her situation will be better.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to provide transportation for the family.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is 58 years old and has 5 children. Dominga is married and has 3 children who are in school.

Dominga is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Dominga requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Dominga has been raising pigs for 3 years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Dominga would like to save enough money to have a rice mill.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Sary Vuth

texts.en:
Sary Vuth, 26, is widower, resides with his mother and one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. He has been running the business of repairing television for over seven years, earning approximately USD 5 per day. Her mother runs groceries store and earns about USD 3 per day. 

Sary Vuth is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more repairing tools to use in his business. This purchase would enable him to have enough tools for his reparation. 

In the future, he would like to rebuild his workshop to make it bigger and purchase a new house to live separately from his mother.

loans.use: to purchase more repairing tools to use in his business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 64 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by raising hogs in the Philippines. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Evelyn has been raising hogs for 14 years and also earns additional income from coconut and pandan weaving.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Elfa

texts.en:
Elfa works hard to support her family. Elfa is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Elfa requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like snack foods, detergent and other groceries.

Elfa has been in this business for 11 years.

In the future, Elfa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like snack food, detergent and other groceries.

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en:
Chenda, 32, is married, resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in weaving and purchasing plastic bag to resale for over seven years, earning approximately USD 4 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about USD 4 per day. 

In order to improve her business, Chenda is requesting a loan of USD 500 to raise capital in her business to purchase more plastic bag to resale. This purchase would enable her to make more profit to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to use the further profit to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more comfortable for her family’s living.

loans.use: to raise capital in her business to purchase more platic bags to resale

loans.name: Freda

texts.en:
Freda is 49 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Freda is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Freda has been raising pigs  for 3 years and also earns additional income from vegetable vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Harselina

texts.en: Harselina is 51 years old. She is  married to Catalino, a farmer in the village of Maligaya. Harselina engaged in her sari-sari store business for  three years. She earns about PHP 300 a day and she used it to provide their daily needs and pay for their monthly electric bill. As of now, Harselina wants to avail PHP 5,000 to buy grocery item such as canned goods, bakery bread, oil, noodles and so on. She hopes to grow her business, to secure her family future.

loans.use: to buy grocery item such as canned goods, bakery bread, oil, noodles and so on

loans.name: Fanny

texts.en:
As a married parent of 7 children, Fanny works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store.  Fanny is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy more rice to sell to customers.

Fanny has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell to customers.

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
Myra is an entrepreneur that has created her own work to help her family progress. She has sari-sari store business in their house and giving her best to make it successful. But insufficient capital is hinder in her achievement. So Myra is asking a loan of P12,000 to buy oil, sugar, breads and rice for her store. 


Myra is hoping for the progress of her family’s living through her availed loan as well as to give her four children best education purposes.

loans.use: to buy oil, sugar, breads and rice for her store

loans.name: Saun

texts.en:
Saun, 59, is widowed and resides with four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in breeding pigs for over ten years, earning approximately USD 4 per day. Three of her children are employed. They are construction workers and garment worker. Approximately, they earn USD 11 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Saun is requesting a loan of USD 500 purchase piglets to breed in order to sell when they gain weight. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more convenient for her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to breed in order to resale when they gain weight

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.en: Hilaria is a hardworking mother who raises hogs. She established the latter enterprise to increase her income. She is the mother of two children. Right now, Hilaria requesting a loan of P25,000 to buy feed, vitamins and medicines for her two pigs for breeding. With proper growth and nutrition, she can sell them for a good price, thereby increasing her income. She aims to have a business well-diversified and establish a stable income for the overall welfare of the family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and medicines for her two pigs for breeding

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a pottery business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy materials needed for her pottery business.

Gemma has been in this business for 2 years. Gemma earns more income from food vending.

Gemma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her pottery.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is kind and enduring woman. She is securing her family’s lives through her repair and install business. She offers power widow, door key and car tint. Her husband also helps her in managing such business. With their conjoin strategies, they are slowly pushing their business into success. 


Now, Merlyn is asking an additional working capital an amount of P50,000 to purchase accessories of door mechanism, door rubber and power window. Hopefully, it would provide her business a higher amount of income for the good quality of life of her three children. 


With the age 52, she is still full of hope that she can achieve comfortable life. She hopes, with her availed loan, her business will boost into a progress.

loans.use: to purchase accessories of door mechanism, door rubber and power window

loans.name: Gene

texts.en:
Gene works hard to support her family. She is married and has a pottery business in the Philippines.

Gene requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her pottery.

She has been in this business for 20 years now, and also earns additional income from variety store.

In the future, Gene would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her pottery.

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en:
Pheap, 29, is married, resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in garment factory for over three years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her husband is a soldier who earns about USD 5 per day. 

Pheap wants to rebuild her present house. With this goal in mind, Pheap requests a loan of USD 1200 to purchase timbers to rebuild her house to make it bigger and more comfortable for her family’s living condition. 

In the future, she would like to run an additional business of purchasing rice to resale to generate more income to support the family. Moreover, she hopes to help her children get bachelor’s degree and get good job.

loans.use: to purchase timbers to rebuild her house

loans.name: Cena

texts.en:
Running a sari-sari (variety) store occupies the daily schedule of Cena. She is 59 years old, married and has four grown-up children. She usually generates an income of about P5,000 monthly. She utilizes it for the business, meals and in paying monthly electric bills. 

She is now asking for a loan of P20,000 to buy canned goods and bottled beverages to sell in her store. She is hoping to meet her customers' demand for affordable prices of merchandise she offers. She also would like to save funds to use in times of emergency.

loans.use: to buy canned goods and bottled beverages to sell in her store

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 51 years old, widow with 2 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Helen has a food vending business in the Philippines. Helen requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Helen has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Helen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. Helen requested a PHP 25000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items like pants, blouses, body lotion and other ready-to wear clothing.

Helen has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Helen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like pants, blouses, body lotion and other ready-to wear clothing.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a balut (fertilized duck egg) business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more eggs for her balut business.

Josefina has been in this business for 15 years. Josefina earns more income from raising livestock.

Josefina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business and renovate her family home in the future.

loans.use: to buy more eggs for her balut.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is married to a farmer and they raise their family in a village of Guayabal. They were gifted with one child and they plan to educate her and give her a better life. Due to hardships of living, Jenny is involved in a buying and selling feed to generate additional income. She has been operating this business for almost three years and usually earns a profit of 1,500 PHP a day that she utilizes for their necessities. 

Jenny plans to improve her business. But due to inadequate capital, she wants to ask for an additional 15,000 PHP to buy more stock of feed to sell in their village. She believes that this loan will be helpful in carrying out their plan and hopes that they will be successful in carrying it out.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and materials needed in hog-raising

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 58 years old and married with 4 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

Shen has been in this business for 30 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack food and other groceries. 

Jocelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en: Amelia is a married with 4 children. She is 35 years old and lives in La Esperanza, Rizal, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Amelia owns and operates a plot of farm land, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for 4 years and earns PHP 3,000 each month. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase farm chemicals. Amelia has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, for a year. In the future, Amelia's plan is to save her returns in order to improve their house.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals

location.town: La Esperanza, Rizal, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Denith

texts.en: Denith is a married who has three children. Denith is 30 years old, and resides at Sinian, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental: Philippines. Denith own and operate a farm land, planting & harvesting banana for sale to earn a living and she's been 3 years in this business. Each month, she earns 2,000 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 6,300.00 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. In 2011, Denith joined GDMPC. In the future, Denith wants to make improvements of her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia aged 52 operates sari-sari store business. She also sells native cakes in the elementary school in the village as additional income. She is patiently do these activities for the welfare of her five children. 


Cecilia is now requesting a loan of P18,000 to buy breads, spices, noodles and flour, milk, sugar in making native cakes.  With this loan amount, she is hoping for the improvement of their lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy breads, spices, noodles and flour, milk, sugar in making native cakes

loans.name: Yern

texts.en:
Yern, 49, is married, resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in garment factory for over ten years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her husband is a security guard who earns about USD 3 per day. One of her children is a garment worker who can earn about USD 3 per day. 

Yern is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase tiles to cover her house’s roof. This money would enable to finish her house’s construction. 

In the future, she would like to run a tailoring shop her daughter and help her children get bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase tiles to cover her house's roof

loans.name: Eulyjean

texts.en:
Eulyjean is 42 years old who engage in hog fattening business as a source of livelihood. With this occupation, she provided her family’s needs and wants. Within 19 years of existing in this business, she is patiently works because of the love of her family. 



Right now, to satisfy also the needs of her hogs, Eulyjean is asking a loan of P25,000 to buy feed,  vitamins, and medicine. She is caring her hogs so much because it will be going to provide her high income after 5-6 months. Hopefully, with her unending hard work she will achieve her dream profit.

loans.use: to buy feed,  vitamins, and medicine

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is married with 2 children. Elvie is 32-years-old and lives in the Caluya, Sapang Dalaga,Philippines.

Elvie is a farmer and she manage a vegetables and banana production to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years and every month she earn 3,600.00 from this work. She has requested a loan of 9,000.00 to purchase fertilizer.

Elvie has been a member of GDMPC for 2 years. In the future, Elvie hopes to finished the study of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. Jocelyn is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Jocelyn requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 8 years.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Kathleen Joy

texts.en:
Kathleen Joy is 23 years old and widowed with 2 children.

Kathleen Joy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

Kathleen Joy has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Kathleen Joy aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Charlie

texts.en: Charlie is from the village of Gauyabal. He is 45 years old. He is married to Teresita and they had been blessed with six children. Charlie engaged in transportation business using his motorcycle. He has been engaged in his business for a long year. He usually received an income of PHP 300 a day. As of now, Charlie is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy paint, wheels and gasoline for the maintenance of his transport motorcycle. Charlie still hopes to find ways to provide for his children's needs.

loans.use: to buy paint, wheels and gasoline for the maintenance of his transport motorcycle

loans.name: Toch

texts.en:
Toch, 54, is married, resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been running the business of purchasing rice to resale for over ten years, earning approximately USD 9 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. Three of her children are employed in garment factory. They earns about USD 9 per day. 

In order to improve her business, Toch is requesting a loan of USD 800 to raise capital in her business to purchase rice to resale. By doing so, she will make more profit to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to use the further profit to expand her business and help her youngest child get bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to raise capital in her business to purchase rice to resale

loans.name: Crisaldy

texts.en:
Crizaldy is 30 years old, a responsible father. He and his wife Amiva have two children. He operates buy and sell of cell phone accessories, cell phone and motor parts as a source of income. He has been in this business for the past seven years and her wife helps him in improving their business. 


And to develop more his business, Crizaldy is asking a loan of P25,000 to buy casing of cell phones, new model of cell phones, charger and helmet.


He hopes to expand his business in order to gain higher income and prosperous living condition. He could also save funds for the future education of his children.

loans.use: to buy casing of cell phones, new model of cell phones, charger and helmet

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en: Emelyn is from Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old. Emelyn is married and has two children. To make a living, Emelyn plants & harvests decorative plants for sale. Emelyn has been in this business for 4 years and earns 1,800 PHP a month for these activities. Emelyn is requesting a loan of 4,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase more seeds to plants. In 2009, Emelyn joined GDMPC. She plans to save the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase more seeds to plants

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is in the business of sari-sari store. With her 52 years of age, half of her age already gives in manipulating her source of income. It is the main source of providing the needs of her three children. Now, she wants to improve more her sari-sari store and build up a new business specifically to hog fattening business. 


In connection to this, she is requesting a loan of P20,000 to buy groceries such as canned goods, soft drinks and 2 piglets. Hopefully, she could successfully build her new business as well as her current business.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as canned goods, soft drinks and 2 piglets

loans.name: Emilda

texts.en: Emilda is a married who has three children. Emilda is 47 years old, and resides at Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental: Philippines. Emilda own and operate a farm land, planting & harvesting durian for sale to earn a living and she's been 3 years in this business. Each month, she earns 7,000 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 10,000.00 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Earlier this year, Emilda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Emilda wants to make improvements of her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Savon

texts.en:
Savon, 40, is married, resides with her husband and five children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in garment factory for over seven years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her husband runs the business of carrying dirt to sell. He earns about USD 5 per day. Two of her children are employed. They are garment worker and construction worker. Approximately, they earn USD 7 per day. 

Due to lack of fund, Savon is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a plot of land for her husband to dig the dirt to sell. By doing so, he will make more profit to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to use the further profit to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land for her husband to dig the dirt to sell

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en:
Chenda, 30, is married, resides with her mother, her husband and one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been running the business of buying poultry to resale for over four years, earning approximately USD 10 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. 

In order to improve her business, Chenda is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to raise capital in her business to purchase more poultry to resale. By doing so, she will make more profit to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to use the further profit to expand her business and send her child to a good school. Moreover, she plans to build a new house to live separately for her mother.

loans.use: to raise capital in her business to purchase more poultry to resale

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is 53 years old. He is married to Elisa. To make a living, Jose provides motorcycle transport services to local community members. He has been engaged to his business for more six months and earns approximately 300 PHP daily.

Right now, Jose is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which he will use to purchase equipment to improve his business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to improve his business

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is involved in retailing business. She is 46 years old and blessed with four children. Running sari-sari store is occupies the daily schedule of Marcelina. She usually generates an income of about PHP 300 a day. She utilized for the business meals and in paying monthly electric bills.

Right now, Marcelina is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, kitchen needs, soft drinks, candies, noodles and bread to sell in her store. She is hoping to meet her customers' demand for affordable prices of merchandise she offers. She also would like to save funds to use in times of emergency.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, kitchen needs, soft drinks, candies, noodles and bread to sell in her store

loans.name: Nary

texts.en:
Nary, 47, is widowed, resides with her father and six children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker who receives support from her children. Three of her children are employed in garment factory. Approximately, they earn USD 12 per day. 

Nary wants to rebuild her present house. With this goal in mind, Nary is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase timbers to rebuild her house. This money will help her provide better living condition for the family. 

In the future, she would like to run a tailoring shop for her children and help her children get bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase timbers to rebuild her house

loans.name: Theriza

texts.en: Theriza is a married woman with two school-aged children. She has a general store where she sells a variety of products. She had been doing this work for four years. Each day, she earns approximately PHP 300. Theriza is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase groceries such as noodles, canned goods, shampoo, soap, sugar, and coffee to sell to the people of the community. She hopes that, through the loan, she can obtain more customers. In the future, she hopes that her business will expand to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase groceries such as noodles, canned goods, shampoo, soap, sugar, and coffee to sell

loans.name: Sipho

texts.en:
Sipho (in the photo), age 52, is a widow with one son who has full-time employment. She lives in a village about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sipho is a garment worker. She is applying for her first loan in the amount of $1,500 to buy a motorcycle for her son to get to and from work. Currently, Sipho’s son works in Phnom Penh, however because his home is quite far from the city he needs to stay with his uncle after work. With a motorbike which he will buy with money from the loan, he will be able to come back home every evening to help support his mother at home.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her son to get to work.

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Lay (in the photo), age 61, is a farmer. Her husband stays at home. She has two sons and one daughter. One has full-time employment, one is a security guard and another one is a soldier. The family lives in a village about eight kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Lay grows banana, papaya and mango. She is requesting her first loan in the amount of $700 to buy a motorbike for her son who is a security guard to get work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her son to get work.

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
Lim, 28, is married, resides with her father, her husband and one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in garment factory for over two years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her husband runs a bicycle repair shop. Approximately, he earns USD 5 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Lim is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase bicycle’s spare parts for her husband to resale. This purchase would enable him to generate more income to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to expand her husband’s business and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase bicycle's spare part for her husband to resale

loans.name: Sinoeun

texts.en:
Sinoeun (in the photo) is 35 years old and her husband; Sorith is 33 years old, live in a village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1995 and have three daughters-two attend school and another one is still young.  

Sinoeun provides manicures and pedicures for people in her village. Her husband is a Tuk Tuk taxi driver. Sinoeun is asking for her first Kiva loan in the amount of $1,000 to buy a new Tuk Tuk for her husband because his prior one is broken, is not fuel-efficient, and cannot be repaired easily.

loans.use: To replace new a Tuk Tuk for her husband.

loans.name: Prong

texts.en:
