Prong (in the photo with her loom), age 39, is a scarf weaver, and her husband, Sovan, age 54, is a construction worker. In addition, Prong also buys some scarf and silk fabric from the fellow weavers in her village and transports them to sell in other provinces. 

Prong and her husband live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1996 and have two children who are in school.  

Prong is asking for her first loan in the amount of $300 to renovate the house where she lives.

loans.use: To renovate the house where she lives.

loans.name: Nozim

texts.ru: Нозим житель города Исфара. Ему 42 года. Он женат. У него двое детей. Нозим занимается торговлей. Он арендует помещение, где открыл продуктовый магазин. Этим видом деятельности Нозим занимается 13 лет. В торговле ему помогает жена. Он берет кредит для приобретения кондитерских изделий.

loans.use: Для приобретения кондитерских изделий

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao (pictured here) is 38 years old and his wife; Ruos is 42 years old, live in suburb of Phnom Penh about 25 kilometers. They have been married since 1993 and have two young children-one son and one daughter.  

Mao is a construction worker, while his wife is a cleaner for a factory. He is applying for his first loan of $800 to buy a motorbike to get to work.

Currently, Mao commutes to work by asking his neighbors to take motorbike with his neighbors. With a motorbike which he will buy with money from the loan, he will have his own transportation and not asking his neighbor any more.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to get to work.

loans.name: Tho

texts.en:
Tho, 37, is married, resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in agricultural business for over ten years, has an extensive experience and is successful in her career. She is involved in growing rice and fattening up cattle. Approximately, she earns USD 3 per day. Her husband carries ice cream to sell in the local community. He earns bout USD 8 per day. 

In order to improve her husband’s business, Tho is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to carry ice cream to sell. This purchase would enable her husband to carry ice cream to sell in larger amount and earn more profit. 

In the future, she would like to build a new wooden house and help her children get bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband to carry ice cream to sell

loans.name: Eng

texts.en:
Eng stays at home. The main source of income is from her husband who is a motor remoque taxi driver. A motor remoque is a motorbike connected with a trailer at the back. 

The elderly couple lives live in a village about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and they have three sons-two are married and another one has full-time employment.    

Eng is applying for a loan in the amount of $1,000 to buy new motorbike for her son to get work because the old one breaks and uses more gasoline.

loans.use: To buy new motorbike for her son to get work.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy A.a 34 years old married with two school aged children. She managed a sari-sari store ( community based store) where she can sell different products. She is very responsible woman who can give all the need of her family. Juvy is asking a loan of P12,000 to purchase another products such as drinks, shampoo, soap and spices for her additional to sell and have additional income to sustain the need of her family.

In the future, Juvy hopes that her store expand so that she can give the quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to buy drinks, shampoo. soap and spices for her store

loans.name: Davlatbek

texts.ru: Давлатбек житель района Дж. Руми. Он продолжает свою деятельность и берет кредит для закупа бычков и телят.

loans.use: Для закупа бычков и телят

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en: Concepcion a very hardworking mother with five grown up children she is 58 years old married to Moises live in the village of Aggasian province of Isabela. She is engaged in hog raising business. In that reason she is requesting a loan of P 12,000 to buy additional piglet to raised and sell in the future and also feed to fatten her pigs. She dreams that someday her business expand so that she can sustain the need of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and additional piglet for her business

loans.name: Zurah

texts.en: Zurah is 29 years old,married with one child. She sells clothes to earn a living,she has been in the business for 3 years and has employed one person. She describes her business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya,she has been able to improve her living standards and hopes to be expand her business in the future. She has applied for 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy clothes for sell.

loans.use: To buy clothes for sell

loans.name: Jenie

texts.en: Jenie is a married woman having 5 children. Jenie is 45 years old, residing at Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Jenie operates a fish selling business while her husband caught-river fish to earn a living and she's been 6 years in this business. Each month, she earns 3,000.00 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 5,000.00 to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. In 2010, Jenie joined GDMPC. In the future, Jenie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Gleen

texts.en: Gleen, married with 3 children. She is 30 years old and lives in Sinian, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Gleen owns and operates a plot of farm land, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for 3 years and earns PHP 2,000 each month. She requested a loan of PHP 4,400 to purchase chemicals for farm production. Gleen has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, for a year. In the future, Gleen's plan is to save her returns in order to improve their living condition.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals for farm production

loans.name: Renson

texts.en: Renson is 41 years old,married with 3 children. He runs a retail shop to earn a living,he has been in the business for 13 years and has employed 2 people. To earn extra income he does motorcycle transport business. Since he joined Faulu Kenya,he has been able to improve his living standards and hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for 40,000 Kenya Shillings to buy plastics chairs and carpets for sell.

loans.use: To buy plastics chairs and carpets for sell.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel is 30 years old, and is married. Maricel is from the village of Del Pilar, she has been engaged in buying and selling medicines in the local community. She has been in this business for six months. Maricel wants to expand her business and she wants also to have her own stall. In this regard, Maricel is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy more medicines to sell. She is hoping that her business will further grow to secure her family standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more medicines to sell

loans.name: Ma. Amie

texts.en: Ma. Amie is 44 years old and lives in Bato, Plaridel, Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Ma. Amie a cassava farm owner for 3 years avail a loan at GDMPC. This farm gain an income, and she gets 2,000 monthly. She ask for a loan of 4,300 to buy fertilizer and young seeds to plant. In 2009, she become a partner of GDMPC and KIVA. The amount she get from her farm will be used in the tuition of her children and to sustain their daily needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and young seeds to plant

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en: Josefina, 58 years old married to Diosdado she is managed a store where she can sell in the community. She is very responsible mother that she can give the need of her family. Josefina is requesting a loan of P 9,000 to buy different products to sell in community. She hopes that her business doing well so that she can expand her business and she can sustain the need of her family.

loans.use: to purchase rice and snack food for her business

loans.name: Muharram

texts.ru: Мухаррам проживает в городе Худжанд. Ей 57 лет. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Она имеет среднее образование. Три года как Мухаррам занимается торговлей. Она у себя во дворе продает лук оптом. Кредит берет для покупки лука.

loans.use: Для покупки лука

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta, married who has three children. Julieta is 55 years old, and resides at Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Julieta plants, harvests and sells cassava for a living and she's been 3 years in this business. Each month, she gets 1,500 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 3,500.00 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. In 2009, Julieta joined GDMPC. In the future, Julieta wants to make improvements of her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 33 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Irene is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and farm supplies.

Irene has been farming vegetables for 3 years and also earns additional income from hog raising.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to expand her business and to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and farm supplies.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 38 years old and married with 3 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Rowena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

She has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, noodles and other miscellaneous items. 

Rowena would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Loddy

texts.en:
Loddy is 31 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising ducks in the Philippines. Loddy is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy feeds for her duck.

Loddy has been raising ducks for 2 years and also earns additional income from eggs retail.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds for her duck.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane is 34 years old and lives in Bato, Plaridel, Philippines. She's a mother of one child. Mary Jane a cassava farm owner for 2 years avail a loan at GDMPC. This farm gain an income, and she gets 2,000 monthly. She ask for a loan of 5,00 to buy fertilizer and young seeds to plant. In 2009, she become a partner of GDMPC and KIVA. The amount she get from her farm will be used to sustain their daily needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and young seeds to plant

loans.name: Chona

texts.en: Chona is 32 years old married with one child. She lived in the village of Aggasian province of Isabela. She managed a store in the community. She is requesting a loan of P 9,000 to purchase additional products to sell in the community. Chona is well known a very diligent person.

loans.use: to purchase rice, drinks and snack food for her store

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 69 years old, married with 5 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Letecia has an avon products and herbal medicines retail business in the Philippines. Letecia requested a PHP 23000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

Letecia has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Letecia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Mae

texts.en:
Ma. Mae is married with 3 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Mae is 25 years old and has 2 children who are in school.

Ma. Mae has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items to sell like soft-drinks, canned goods and other miscellaneous items.

Ma. Mae has been in this business for 9 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like soft-drinks, canned goods and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a variety store business in the Philippines.

Marilyn requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like shampoo, groceries etc. to sell in her store.

She has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like shampoo, groceries etc. to sell in her store.

loans.name: Mon

texts.en:
Mon, 29, is married, resides with his wife and one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. He has been working as a construction worker for over three years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. His wife is a garment worker who earns about USD 3 per day. 

Due to lack of fund, Mon is requesting a loan of USD 400 to purchase construction materials to build his house. This money will help him finish his house’s construction and provide better living condition for his family. In 

the future, he plans to send his child to good school.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build his house

loans.name: Iluminada

texts.en:
Iluminada is 60 years old, married with 3 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Iluminada has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Iluminada requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

Iluminada has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Iluminada would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additonal fish to sell

loans.name: Emilda

texts.en:
Emilda is 32 years old and married with 4 children. With 3 children in school, Emilda works very hard to provide for them.

Emilda runs a direct selling of avon products in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell.

Emilda has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as lotion, perfumes, shoes, etc.. 

In the future Emilda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more stocks to sell

loans.name: Norhoda

texts.en:
Norhoda works hard to support her family. Norhoda is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Norhoda requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for motorcycle maintenance.

Norhoda has been in this business for 7 years now.

In the future, Norhoda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for motorcycle maintenence

loans.name: Teodorica

texts.en:
Teodorica is married with 7 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Teodorica is 47 years old and has 4 children who are in school.

Teodorica has a fishing business in the Philippines. Teodorica requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase fishing net and materials for her business.

Teodorica has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Teodorica would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fsihing net and materials for her business

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
Monina is 48 years old and married with 2 children.

Monina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

Monina has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns an income from E-loading.

Monina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.ru: Бахтиёр житель города Худжанд. Ему 40 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Бахтиёр занимается скотоводством. В этой области он 12 лет. Кредит берет для закупа телят с целью увеличения поголовья крупного рогатого скота.

loans.use: Для закупа телят

loans.name: Vivencia

texts.en:
Vivencia works hard to support her family. Vivencia is married and has a buying and selling of dried fish business in the Philippines.

Vivencia requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell.

Vivencia has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Vivencia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks to sell

loans.name: Maternidad

texts.en:
Maternidad works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Maternidad requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

Maternidad has been in this business for 10 years now, and also earns additional income from selling snack food.

In the future, she wants to save money to expand her business and send her kid to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Maritta

texts.en:
Maritta is 57 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Maritta is borrowing PHP 19000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Maritta has been farming rice for 10 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is married with 2 children. Rowena is 30-years-old and lives in the Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Rowena is a farmer and she manages a coconut production to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years and every month she earn 1,000.00 from this work. She has requested a loan of 3,000.00 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.

Rowena has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Rowena hopes to finished the study of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Marfe

texts.en:
As a married parent of 2 children, Marfe works hard to support her family.

She has a poterry business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Marfe is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy materials needed for her pottery business.

Marfe has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her pottery.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 69 years old, widow with 4 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Mercedita has a general store business in the Philippines. Mercedita requested a PHP 25000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more goods like shampoo, soft-drinks, snack foods and other groceries.

She has been in this business for 12 years. Mercedita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more goods like shampoo, soft-drinks, snack foods and other groceries.

loans.name: Ninia

texts.en:
Ninia is 44 years old and married with three children.

Ninia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

Ninia has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from food vending and coffee shop.

Ninia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 51 years old and married with 3 children.

Nenita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell.

Nenita has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 19 years and also earns an income from local eatery.

Nenita aspires to save money to expand her business and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie hardworking and very loving mother of two grown up children. She managed a store where she can sell different products in the community. Rosemarie is asking a loan of P 7,000 to buy additional products that she can sell in the people of the community. Rosemarie hopes that her store renovate someday so that more convenient for her costumer.

loans.use: to buy noodles, spices, coffee, sugar and drinks for her store

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is 47 years old and has 3 children. Dominga is married and has one child who is in school.

Dominga is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Dominga requested a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Dominga has been for 10 years now, and has borrowed 29 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Dominga would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna is 43 years old. She is a hardworking woman who raises hogs for future sale; she established the latter enterprise to increase her income. She lives with her parents in the village of Nagrumbuan. Myrna is now requesting a loan of P12,000 to buy feed, vitamins and medicines for her hogs. With proper growth and nutrition, she can sell them for a good price, thereby increasing her income. Myrna aims to have a business well-diversified and establish a stable income for the overall welfare of the family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and medicines for her hogs

loans.name: Sothea

texts.en:
Sothea (pictured here) is 40 years old and her husband; Sarin is 42 years old, live in suburb of Phnom Penh about 25 kilometers. They have been married since 1993 and they have two sons and one daughter. Two are garment workers and another one attends school.  

Sothea sells vegetable and meat, while her husband is a security guard. She is asking for her first loan of $1,500 to buy a motorbike for her children to get work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her children to get work.

loans.name: Sareun

texts.en:
Sareun (in the photo), age 60, is a construction worker. His wife, Seun, age 58, stays at home and does house work. The elderly couple has been marries since 1972 and they have three daughters-two are garment workers and another one is in school. They live in a suburb of Phnom.

Sareun is requesting his first loan of $1,500 to buy a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Seum

texts.en:
Seum, 64, is married, resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in agricultural business for over twenty years, have an extensive experience and are successful in their career. They are involved in growing rice and fattening up cattle. Approximately, they earn USD 4 per day. One of her children is a garment worker who earns about USD 3 per day. 

Seum wants to run an additional business in order to improve her family’s economy. Therefore, Seum is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase motorbike and a trailer to carry ice to sell in the village. This purchase would enable her to generate extra income to support the family. 

in the future, she would like to run groceries store at home and rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for her family’s living.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike and a trailer to carry ice to sell in the village

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie is from Landing, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old, married, and has four children. To make a living, she operates a coconut production. She has been in her business for 5 years and gets 2,200 a month for these activities. In 2010, Rosemarie joined GDMPC. Rosemarie is requesting a loan of 5,500 PHP which will be used to pay for the labor cost in farm maintenance. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to pay for the labor cost in farm maintenance

loans.name: Seur

texts.en:
Seur (in the photo), age 33, sells grocery items at home and grows rice when rice farming season come. Her husband, Phorn, age 32, is a construction worker. Seur is applying for her first loan in the amount of $300 to expand her grocery store by buying more grocery items for resale.  

They live in a village near the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and they have four children-three sons and one daughter. One attends school and other three are still young.

loans.use: To expand her grocery store by buying more grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en: Flordeliza is 52 years old married with four grown up children. She is a vendor where she can sell different vegetables in the community. Flordeliza is very hardworking person she can plant vegetable in her backyard. To have additional income she is requesting a loan of P 8,000 to buy squash, eggplant and banana for her business. In the future, Flordeliza hopes that her business expand so that she can give the need of her family.

loans.use: to buy squash, eggplant and banana for her business

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.en:
Encarnacion is 48 years old and has 8 children. Encarnacion is married and has 4 children who are in school.

Encarnacion is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Encarnacion requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Encarnacion has been raising pigs for 3 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Encarnacion would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Sokhors

texts.en:
Sokhors (pictured here) is 30 years old and her husband, Sophat is 39 years old, have been married since 2001 and have two daughters-one is in school and another one is still young. The family lives in a village approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sokhors is a tailor, while her husband is a driver. She is asking for a loan of $1,500 to replace new motorbike for her husband because the old one breaks and uses more gasoline.

loans.use: To replace new motorbike for her husband.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar is 60 years old, married with 4 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Pilar has a salt and shrimp paste making business in the Philippines. Pilar requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her shrimp paste making.

Pilar has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Pilar would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her shrimp paste.

loans.name: Samphors

texts.en:
Samphors (in the photo) is 28 years old and her husband, Pheaktra is 28 years old, live in a village about 35 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and they have one son who is in school. 

Samphors is a garment worker, while her husband is a construction worker. She is asking for her first loan in the amount of $600 to fill-in the land behind of her house because there are some ponds in behind of her house, so she needs to fill it in.

loans.use: To fill-in the land behind of her house.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie works hard to support her family. Rosalie is married and has a buying and selling of rice grains business in the Philippines.

Rosalie requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Rosalie has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Rosalie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additioanal sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Donalyn

texts.en: A very young married woman Donalyn is 26 years old. She managed a store for eight years and she earn approximately P 2,000 a month. To have additional products to sell, Donalyn is asking a loan of P 5,000 to purchase rice, snack foods and drinks for her store. Donalyn dreams that someday she can build a store in front of their house so that she sustain the need of her family.

loans.use: to buy rice, spices, snack food and drinks for her store

loans.name: Ma. Loreta

texts.en:
Ma. Loreta is from the village of Nagrumbuan. She is 47 years old and is married to Gilbert, a farmer in their village. Ma. Loreta is engaged in hog-raising business for  a long year and she usually earn PHP 7,000 after disposing time. 

Ma. Loreta wants to buy additional hog to raise, but she lack the necessary capital. In this regard, Ma. Loreta is asking a loan in the amount of PHP 12,000 to buy feed, vaccine and additional hog to raise. She mentioned that this loan will help her to improve the business and make her dream comes true.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccine and additional hog to raise

loans.name: Khorn

texts.en: Khorn, 52, is widowed and resides with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling noodle for over three years, earning approximately USD 4 per day. Her children are employed in garment factory. They earn about USD 6 per day. Khorn wants to rebuild her present house. With this goal in mind, Khorn is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase timbers to rebuild her house. This money will help her to finish her house’s building and provide better living condition for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase timbers to rebuild her house

loans.name: Pechie

texts.en:
Pechie works hard to support her family. She is married and has selling ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines.

Pechie requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like pants, socks, blouses and other clothing.

She has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Pechie would like to save money to expand her business and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more items like pants, socks, blouses and other clothings.

loans.name: Pevi

texts.en:
Pevi is 47 years old, married and has four children.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Pevi requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for 5 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Pevi would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
Rhodora is 33 years old and married with one child.

Rhodora works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

Rhodora has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Rhodora aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Bunny

texts.en:
Bunny (in the photo), age 56, is widow with one son who is a security guard. She lives in a village about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Bunny sells second hand clothes and cosmetics. She is applying for her first loan of $1,000 to expand her business by buying more clothes and cosmetics for resale.

loans.use: To expand her business by buying more clothes and cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 41 years old and married with 5 children.

Veronica works hard to provide for her family. She runs a tobacco and vegetables retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell.

Veronica has borrowed and paid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the tobacco and vegetables retail business for 9 years and also earns an income from raising pigs and water buffalo.

Veronica aspires to save enough money so she could send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more stocks to sell

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 31 years old and has 3 children. Rowena is married and has 3 children who are in school.

Rowena is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Rowena requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Rowena has been raising pigs for 12 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is 31 years old and married with four children.

Aileen works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy stock of groceries to sell in her store.

Aileen has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 6 years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Aileen aspires to save enough money to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
Monina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP  through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her restaurant.

Monina has been in this business for 6 years. Monina earns more income from ice candy & fruit vending.

Monina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional ingredients for her restaurant business

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en:
Bonifacia is a 53-year-old married woman with 2 children ages 27 and 18. Her husband works as a fisherman. Bonifacia is also involved in fishing. She helps her husband with their business by selling his catch at the market. She also buys more fish from other fishermen in their town. According to her, their monthly income from fishing is 10000 PHP.

Bonifacia is requesting a loan to purchase fishing nets, nylon and lead weights. Bonifacia hopes for their business to grow and for her family to be in good health always.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, nylon and lead weights

loans.name: Saret

texts.en:
Saret (in the photo), age 33, sells fish and her husband, Binsean, age 35, is a construction worker. They live in a village about twenty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh and have three sons-two are attending school and another is still young. 

Saret is asking for her first loan in the amount of $500 to assist in her parents who are rice farmers by buying water pumping machine.

loans.use: To assist in her parents’ farming business by buying water pumping machine.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en: Mila is recognized as a oriented person. She is engaged in hog-raising business for a long year. She is 50 years old and blessed with two children.  Mila is married to a farmer. As of now, Mila wants to receive a loan in the amount of 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. This business helps Mila, because it's the only source of income she has to raise her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Dara

texts.en:
Dara, age 24, is single, live with his parents and sisters and brothers in a village approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Dara is a motor remoque taxi driver. A motor remoque is a motorbike connected with a trailer at the back. He is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike for his family commuting. 

Photo: Dara with a motorbike which he operates a motor remoque taxi driver business.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for his family commuting.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is 28 years old and is a married woman with 2 children ages 15 and 10. Her husband works as a window glass maker. Jocelyn works with her husband and helps manages their glass making business, which have been around for 5 years. Jocelyn works hard to improve their business and take care of her family. She is requesting a loan to buy more glass and window frames. Jocelyn hopes to have a stable income.

loans.use: to buy more glass and window frames

loans.name: Carlosa

texts.en:
Carlosa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Carlosa requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

She has been in this business for 7 years.

In the future, Carlosa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Ma. Visitacion

texts.en: Ma. Visitacion is 36 years old married and she managed a store where she can sell different products in the community. Ma. Visitacion is very kind person and responsible to her family. She asking a loan of P 14,000 to buy additional products such as Snack food, noodles, coffee and rice for her store. Ma. Visitacion hopes that her store expand so that she can renovate her store for more convenient to her costumer so that she can increase her income and she can sustain the need of her family.

loans.use: to purchase snack food, noodles, coffee and rice for her store

loans.name: Zulkhumor

texts.ru: Зулхумор замужем имеет одного ребенка. У них дружная семья. Муж предприниматель. Зулхумор на протяжении 16 лет занимается купле продажей мужской одежды и обуви. С наступлением весны она хочет расширить ассортимент своего товара. В 2010 году она получила первый займ в ИМОН. Займ помог ей в расширении бизнеса. Она хотела бы получить займ для покупки летней одежды и обуви с целью расширения своего бизнеса. Она надеется на вашу помощь и милосердие.

loans.use: To buy clothes and shoes

loans.name: Vann

texts.en:
Vann (pictured here), age 43, is single. She lives with her nephew in a village across Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.
Vann is a teacher and when she is free from teaching, she grow rice tomato, bean and sesame that assisting by her nephew. She is applying for her first loan in the amount of $300 to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm.

loans.name: Sokunthea

texts.en: Sokunthea, 31, is married, resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in garment factory for over three years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her husband runs public transportation service. He earns about USD 4 per day. Due to the present motorbike is too old; Sokunthea is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to replace the old one to run the service. This purchase would enable her husband to attract more customers and earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to run an additional business of buying rice to resale for a profitable price to generate extra income to support the family and help her children get bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to replace the old one to run the service

loans.name: Kimnang

texts.en:
Kimnang is 40 years old and her husband, Ponlork is 42 years old, have been married for almost ten years and they just have one daughter who is assisting her parents in the business. The family lives in a village about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Kimnang is a wedding planning decorator and she rents out traditional Khmer clothes for weddings (in the photo with Kimnag). Her husband is cameraman who takes pictures for weddings alongside his wife.

Cambodian people prefer to rent wedding planning decoration and traditional clothes to attend during the wedding party.
Kimnang is asking for her first loan of $700 to purchase one more camera for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase one more camera for her husband.

loans.name: Edilberta

texts.en:
Edilberta works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling banana in the Philippines.

Edilberta requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more banana to sell to customers.

She has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Edilberta would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more banana to sell to customers.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is married to a farmer and they raise their family in a village. They were blessed with four children and they plan to educate them and give them a better life. Due to hardships of living, Angelina is involved in a hog-raising business to generate additional income. She has been operating this business for almost three years and usually earns a profit of 7,000 PHP a month that she utilizes for their necessities and allowances of their children. 

She plans to improve her pigpen and raise more pigs. But due to inadequate capital, she wants to ask for an additional 13,000 PHP to buy feed, vitamins and materials needed in hog-raising.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and materials needed in hog-raising

loans.name: Consesa

texts.en: Consesa is from Sta.Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old. Consesa is married and has 2 children. To make a living, Consesa owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting flowers for sale. Consesa been 3 years in this business and earns 9,000 a month. In 2010, Consesa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Consesa is requesting a loan of 35,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Loyda

texts.en: A very diligent and hardworking person, Loyda is requesting a loan of P 9,000 to buy kitchen utensil for her business. Loyda is 34 years old married with two school-aged-children. She hope that someday she can build a stall for her business so that it easily to display the items she can sell in the community.

loans.use: to buy Tupperware, kitchen utensil for her business

loans.name: Thea

texts.en: Thea, 40, is married, resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up cattle for over twenty years, earning approximately USD 2 per day. Her husband runs the business of buying junk materials to resale. Approximately, he earns USD 5 per day. Her children are employed in garment factory. They earn about USD 8 per day. Due to the difficulty in the family’s transportation, Thea is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and build a new wooden house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is 43 years old from Ndunyu and is married to Lydia. They have eight children who are all in school.

Geoffrey is a farmer and and has been in it for the past one year and has applied for his first loan from Kadet Ltd to enable him buy seedlings for his farm.

He hopes to see his business expand and to have much harvest.

loans.use: To buy seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Rosalina is from Seti,Jimenez,Misamis Occidental. She is 57 years old. Rosalina is married and has 6 children. To make a living, Rosalina raises livestock particularly cow for sale. Rosalina has been in her business for 7 years and earns 8,400 PHP a month for these activities. In 2008, Rosalina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalina is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana is 27 years old. He lives in a small village of Tskaltubo District. She lives with her family: husband – Zaza, 5 years old daughter, 4 years old son and father in law. The family earns on living through agricultural business. They have plot of the land, where greens are grown. Zaza sells harvested greens on Kutaisi (nearby town) market. Total average monthly income of the family is 150 Laris per month. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to subsistence poor category. 

Manana requested credit for construction of greenhouses. Her loan request was approved in the frames of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit Manana will purchase materials for greenhouses construction (iron pillars and polyethylene) and seeds of vegetables. Zaza and Manana will grow greens, cucumbers and tomatoes in the greenhouses during whole year. They will sell harvested products on Kutaisi Market. The income of the family will significantly increase. They will be able to combat the poverty and in the future the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: To purchase materials for greenhouse construction and seeds of vegetables

loans.name: Sagyn

texts.ru:
Сагын 54 года, вдова, имеет 2 детей. 25 лет назад Сагын  начала заниматся животноводством, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы 5,000 сом (KGS). В настоящее время хозяйство Сагын насчитывает 2 дойных коров и 1 лошадь и приносит  около 4,000 сом (KGS)   в месяц от продажи молока  и молочных продуктов.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Сагын обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп бычков на откорм и перепродажу.  Доходы от кредита Сагын планирует вложить в увеличение хозяйства.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Hon

texts.en: Hon, 44, is married, resides with her husband and six children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are sculptors who earn approximately USD 5 per day. Four of her children are employed in garment factory. Approximately, they earn USD 12 per day. In order to improve her business, Hon is requesting a loan of USD 1500 to purchase more metal to produce more sculptural things to sell. By doing so, she would be able to earn more income to stabilize her family’s living condition. In the future, she would like to use the further profit to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase more metal to produce more sculptural things to sell

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 60 years old and is married to Benjamin. They lived in the village of Nagrumbuan. She is a responsible mother of three children. Remedios raises hogs in order to acquire an income and to lift her family out of poverty. Remedios usually raises hogs to fatten and breed. She has been doing this for two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP for each hog disposed.

Remedios wants to improve her hog-selling business and is in need of additional capital so she is now asking for a loan of PHP 13,000 to buy additional piglets to raise and buy feed for sustainability. 

In the future, she would like to make stronger her small business and continuously acquire profits from it.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and buy feed for sustainability

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a food vendor from Talibon, Bohol. She is 38 years old and is a married woman with 5 children with ages between 3 months and 17 years old. Alma's husband works as a driver.

Alma has been a food vendor for 5 years. She sells banana and camote (sweet potato) cue, rice cakes and pancakes. She earns 2000 PHP per month with this business. She is requesting a loan to buy more ingredients such as flour, sugar, oil and bananas. Alma hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients such as flour, sugar, oil and bananas

loans.name: Mylene Faith

texts.en: Mylene Faith is 26 years old, married and has one child. She is from San Juan Panaon, Misamis Occidental. To make a living, Mylene Faith plants and harvests a variety of vegetables for sale. Mylene Faith been 2 years in her business. In 2009, Mylene Faith joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Mylene Faith is requesting a loan of 7,000 which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en: Wilfredo is a 53-year-old fisherman from Talibon, Bohol. He has been a fisherman for 10 years. Wilfredo earns about 10000 PHP per month from fishing. He is able to provide for his family's daily needs with his income. Wilfredo works hard to improve the standard of living of his family. He requested a loan to purchase fishing nets, nylon and lead weights. Wilfredo hopes for this loan to help improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, nylon and lead weights

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer lives in bor. She sells food stalls, and has been in business for one year. She is 24 year old, married, and has three children; two of them are still in school. 

Amer heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase sugar, salt. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, salt for sale.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is a 50-year old resident of Mohon, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She provides her 7 children needs from the little amount of 3,000 she gains monthly from her own piggery business for 5 years as an aid to the income gained from her husband. However in 2009 she's been a member of GDMPC, and she applies a loan at GDMPC micro finance of 5,000 to buy feeding supplies. Virginia wants to make expansion to her business one day.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies

loans.name: Roeurn

texts.en: Roeurn, 52, is widowed and resides with four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up cattle for over twenty years and is successful in her career. Additionally, she sells Khmer traditional medicine (herbal medicine) to generate more income to support the family. Approximately, she earns USD 5 per day. Two of her children are employed in garment factory. They earn about USD 8 per day. Due to the difficulty in the family’s economy, Roeurn is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a small pig farm and help her children get bachelor’s degree

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute

loans.name: Ludy

texts.en:
Ludy is 52 years old and widow with 4 children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ludy is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Ludy has been raising pigs for 2 years and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Ma. Leonora

texts.en: Ma. Leonora is a 37-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She is in the business of pottery making. She has had this business for 8 years and earns about 5000 PHP per month. She requested a loan to buy more clay and painting supplies. Ma. Leonora is hoping to have a better income that would enable her to sustain her children's college education.

loans.use: to buy more clay and painting supplies

loans.name: Regine

texts.en: Regine is 27 years old. She has been running a retail business for three years. Regine has requested the loan to buy more sugar, cooking oil and flour for sell. She plans to use the profits to reinvest in the same business. In the future, Regine wants to see her business expands.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, cooking oil and flour for sell.

loans.name: Marisue

texts.en:
Marisue lives at Cataggaman with her spouse and three children. To make a living, her spouse provides a daily motorcycle transport services to the people in their village. This way, the family earns about P8,000 each month and was just enough for meals, electric bills, and school expenses of her children. She would like to make improvements on their business so that their income will increase too. She would like to ask for a loan of P8,000 to pay for franchise renewal and buy tires and crude oil for the motorcycle. She would like to ensure a safety travel for the passengers and to her husband's lives as well. 
Marisue is also praying for good health and a happy family.

loans.use: to pay for franchise renewal and buy tires and crude oil for the motorcycle

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas is a 36 years old married woman with three children. To make a living, her spouse operates a motorcycle transport service to the people in the village where they live. They had been doing it for over 10 years now. Felicitas usually earns about P7,500 each month in the business they had. This goes mainly for school expenses of her children. 

Felicitas would like to make improvements on their services so she is now asking for a loan of P14,000 to buy crude oil, tires and gasoline for maintenance of the motorcycle. This way, they could improve the services they offered to the passengers. 

In the future, Felicitas would like to achieve a stable source of income so she will be able to make her family financially stable.

loans.use: to buy crude oil, tires and gasoline for maintenance of the motorcycle

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is a sari-sari store owner from Talibon, Bohol. She is 38 years old, married with 3 children ages between 1 month and 13. Erlinda sells various items like shampoo, vinegar, soy sauce and snacks. She works hard to earn better and support her family. She is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell such as soap, shampoo, snacks and canned goods. She hopes to expand her store soon. Erlinda also dreams to be a successful businesswoman in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as soap, shampoo, snacks and canned goods

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: At age 39, Rosemarie had already been blessed with three children. All attends to school. All she wanted is to provide a good education and employment someday. Rosemarie and her spouse untiringly generates income for the family. Her spouse provides motorcycle transport services to the people in their village while she was raising hogs to sell. She would like to provide maintenance to their motorcycle unit so that her sposue will continously provide a safety travel for the passengers. In this matter, she is now asking for an additional capital of P10,000 to buy new pairs of tires and crude oil for the motorcycle. In the future, Rosemarie would like to improve their earnings for the overall welfare of the family.

loans.use: to buy new pairs of tires and crude oil for the motorcycle.

loans.name: Ayau

texts.en:
Ayau lives in bor. She sells food stalls, and has been in business for one year. She is 26 year old, married, and has four children; two of them are still in school. 

Ayau heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase sugar, beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans, sugar for sale.

loans.name: Lay

texts.en: Lay, 30, is married, resides with her mother, her husband and one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in garment factory for over six years, earning approximately USD 5 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about USD 4 per day. In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Lay is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase farmland for growing agricultural crops. This money will help her acquire the security to start the business and generate more income to support the family. In the future she would like to build a new house and help her children get bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase farmland for growing agricultural crops

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose aged 35 years. She runs a retail business for which she has been running for the past four years. She wants the loan to buy rice, sugar, salt and cooking oil. With the profits, Rose plans to use for reinvest in the business.In the picture, Rose was at the parking yard of the bank.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar, and salt for sell.

loans.name: Nji

texts.en:
He is married with two children and they live in Alankie a quarter in Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon.  The main challenges he has faced are sickness in his family, no adequate finance to sponsor his children in school, unemployment, accident and rampant death in his family and he hates thinking about these things.

He has taken and repaid his loans ten times and says if given the new loan requested he will buy more piglets, feeds and also use some of the money for farming purpose. He is very positive the business will succeed because the demand of pigs is high in his neighbor hood, many occasions are celebrated with the consumption of pig meat and also he supplies food crops in his quarter and neighboring quarter. He says with this business the community will benefit from manure which will be used for crop fertility, provide employment to the community since he will hire people to work in his farm.

He promise that the profit from the loan will be used for his children education, feeding of his family, expansion of his pig farm and employment of more workers and he prefers a loan from GHAPE because training is given before loan disbursement and also give out loans to the poor at low interest rates with installmental payment.

loans.use: Purchase of piglets,feeder ,feed and construction of pig style

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 56 years old. He lives in a small village of Zestaponi District with his family: two sons (21 and 15 years old), daughter in law and 1 years old granddaughter. David’s wife is an emigrant; she works abroad and assists financially to her family. 

David earns on living through agricultural business. They have a milk cow and 200 nut trees. Dairy products are mainly consumed by the family; small surplus and nut harvest are sold on Zestaponi District by David. Total average monthly income of the family from the above-mentioned activities is 150 Laris. David’s wife sends them money monthly, but still, according to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

David requested credit for start-up of a small poultry farm. His loan request was approved in the frames of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit David will purchase chicken and place them in the old hen-house, located in family yard. Also part of the credit will be used for purchasing food for the chicken.  He will grow chicken and start their sales in 3-4 months. Also David will sell eggs as well. According to his estimations the monthly income of the family will increase by 300 – 350 Laris. It will mean 100 – 133% increase. The family will be able to improve their living conditions. In addition to the abovementioned, in the future the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on country’s capital market, for further expansion of their new business.

loans.use: to purchase chicken tio start-up a poltry farm

loans.name: Violita

texts.en: Violita is from Lapinig, Kapatagan, Lanao Del Norte. She is 31 years old. Violita is married and has three children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store and she also makes and sells baskets which is made of lagpakanay. She has been in her business for 4 years and earns 10,000 a month for these activities. In 2011, Violita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to buy more stocks to sell and to buy more lagpakanay used in making baskets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell and to buy more lagpakanay used in making baskets

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a thirty one  year old married woman.She keeps fish and grows mushrooms and has been in the business for seven years now and gets a monthly income of KES. 20,000. 


This will be her first loan with KADET LTD, she plans to use the entire loan to purchase more mushroom plants. In future she wants to expand her business and improve the standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more mushroom plants

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is a responsible mother of two children, who aims to become successful in the future. She is 43 years old and married to Rolando. She is engaged in a hog-raising business to help her husband to generate income to satisfy their family's needs. She has been in this business for almost seven years and usually earns profits of PHP 8,000 for every two pigs she sells.

Rosalia planned to acquire more pigs to raise but she didn't have enough capital, therefore, she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. She mentioned that this loan will help her to improve her business and she hopes that she will make her business grow in future.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Yar

texts.en:
Yar lives in bor. She sells food stalls, and has been in business for two year. She is 28 year old, married, and has three children; two of them are still in school. 

Yar heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1200 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase sugar, maize flour. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, maize flour for sale.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose aged 27. She is married to a businessman and they have both one child aged 2. She has requested the loan to add more merchandise like sugar, rice and utensils in her boutique for which she has been running for the past three years. With the profits she plans to make more investments in the same business.

loans.use: To add more items in the boutique such as sugar, rice, and utensils for sell.

loans.name: Twitezimbere /cyrkr Group

texts.fr:
Domitien fait partie du groupe Twitezimbere/Cyrkr. Il a 31 ans, il est marie avec 5 enfants de 1ans à 14 ans, dont 3 scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Domitien est agriculteur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser des semences sélectionnées et des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. Dans les prochaines années, Domitien voudrait être le premier agriculteur dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de scolariser ses enfants.

loans.use: Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.

loans.name: Razel

texts.en: Razel, a 31-year-old single mom with one child, lives in Cabgan, Tambulig Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Razel used her last loan to purchase additional goods to sell in her sari-sari store. Her business grown up and become successful. By now, she's taking a new loan to purchase supplementary goods for her general store. Positively, she hopes to be able to grow up more her business.

loans.use: to purchase supplementary goods for her general store

loans.name: Zachie

texts.en: Zachie is 31 years old. She has been running for the past ladies clothes. With the loan she will add more skirts, and blouses for sale. She has been planning to use the profits for reinvest in the same business. She would like to see her business prosper in the future.

loans.use: To buy more ladies clothes for sell.

loans.name: Atong

texts.en:
Atong lives in bor. She sells food stalls, and has been in business for two year. She is 36 year old, married, and has four children; two of them are still in school. 

Atong heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1200 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans, onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans, onions for sale.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 37 years old and single.She sells second had clothes and has been in the business for the past five years.

This is her first loan in KADET LTD.She was introduced to KADET  LTD by a client.She will use the loan to purchase stock of clothes for resale in her business .

She hopes to open a boutique in the near future.

loans.use: Purchase  more stock of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Consolee

texts.en: Consolee is 39 years old. She married to electrician and they have both four children for who all attend school. She sells fabrics of which she has been selling for the past 8 years. With the loan, Consolee will buy more fabrics for sell. She has an idea of paying school fees from the profits she will obtain from the business.she has a big vision of her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more fabrics for sell.

loans.name: Yom

texts.en:
Yom lives in bor. She sells food stalls, and has been in business for four year. She is 30 year old, married, and has three children; two of them are still in school. 

Yom heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her forth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase sugar, beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans, sugar for sale.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is responsible mother who is engaged in hog-raising business. She is 50 years old and has two children. Elma is married to Robert. At her age, Elma is still works hard to give her children a better quality of life by doing something that brings additional income. She has been involved in buying and selling hogs for over five years and has extensive experience in this business.

Elma dreams to lift her children from poverty, and she wants also to provide the necessities for her hogs, thus she wants to avail a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy feed, vaccine, and vitamins for her hogs. She hopes this will make them fit and nourished, and provide higher prices when it is time for them to be sold.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccine, and vitamins for her hogs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more seasonal clothes.

loans.name: Ameen

texts.en: Ameen is a 27 year old young man who is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. He is engaged and will get married soon and for this occasion he needs to purchase new bedroom furniture. Ameen has an amount of money which is not enough to pay the full amount, so he needs to take a loan of amount $1,500 from FATEN. When Ameen gets the loan, he will purchase new bedroom furniture. This enable him to prepare well for his wedding and let he and his wive live in better conditions. Ameen is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase new bedroom for his wedding.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make some repairs to his taxi.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 39 year old man and married with two sons and two daughters.

He is a taxi driver and earns a decent salary.  Mohammad wants to pay for proper licensing and make some repairs to his taxi, like painting, changing doors and tires, etc.  But he cannot afford the cost.  So he needs to take a loan in the amount of 3,000 from FATEN. 

When Mohammad gets the loan and increases his income, he will be able to offer a better standard of living for his family.

loans.use: to pay for proper licensing and making some repairs to his taxi, painting, changing doors and tires, etc.

loans.name: Rolando Jose

texts.es: Don Rolando de 41 años de edad, Originario de Pueblo Nuevo, casado, tiene un hijo de 11 años de edad, el es comerciante, se dedica al a venta de carne y pollo puso su negocio hace tres años, con capital propio. Ya que el estudio administración de empresas pero la escasez de trabajo  lo motivo  empezar  poner su propio negocio y ejercer lo que aprendió y sacar adelante a su familia.  El requiere el préstamo para compra de pollo, carne y granos básicos. Pues se acerca la temporada navideña y sus clientes le hacen mas demanda de estos productos. El tiene proyectado poner otros puesto de venta de pollo y carne, comprar un nuevo freezer para almacenar sus productos, ya que su idea de expandir su negocio.
texts.en: Rolando is 41 years old and is a native of Pueblo Nuevo.  He is married and has an 11 year-old child.  He works in retail trade, selling meat and chicken.  He started his business 3 years ago with his own capital.  He was motivated to start his own business because he had studied business administration, but due to the lack of jobs this was the only way that he could use his education and provide for his family.  He needs a loan to buy chicken, meat and staple grains, as the Christmas season is approaching and his customers will be increasing their demand for these products. He has plans to expand his business by setting up another stand where he can sell chicken and meat and purchasing a new freezer to store his products.

loans.use: to buy chicken, meat and staple grains

loans.name: Davaajav

texts.en: Davaajav, 27, is a serviceman, and he has been working for five years at a private auto service business. He lives with his wife and does not have any children yet. Davaajav is a very hard-working and sensible businessman. He plans to build an apartment complex in the district near the colleges and rent the units to students or other people who need housing. Over the last several years, there has been a lot of population growth in the districts of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Therefore, he needs to increase his income in order to have capital for his new business. Davaajav plans to start a taxi business to supplement the income from his current job by working at night and on his day off, but he does not have the money to purchase a car. He needs over MNT 3,000,000 to cover the cost of purchasing a car for his taxi business.

loans.use: to purchase a car for his taxi business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make some repairs to his taxi.

loans.name: Adel

texts.en:
Adel is a 40-year-old man, and a father of 4 sons and daughters.

Adel started his own business 7 years ago selling sanitary napkins and tools, and through these years he has been able to expand the shop space and add a few more products such as cosmetics to sell in his store. Now he has applied for a loan to enhance the products that he sells in the store by bringing in better quality cosmetics and perfumes too.

loans.use: To add more cosmetics and perfumes to his inventory

loans.name: Amil

texts.ru: Amil yavlyayetsya IDP personom i pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Amil 50 let. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey. Uje 7 let kak on rabotayet taxistom. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyego otca kotoriy bil toje taxistom. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi klupit zapchasti dlya pochinki svoyey mashini. Yego deti uchatsya v kolledje.
texts.en: Amil is an international displaced person and a refuge from the city of Fuzuli. He now lives in the Fuzuli region with his family. Amil is 50 years old. He is married and has two children. His children are attending college. For the last seven years he has been working as a taxi driver. He has inherited this business from his father who was also a taxi driver. Currently Amil needs a loan of 2000 AZN in order to buy spare parts to repair his car.

loans.use: to purchase car spare parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional seeds and young crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase his store's inventory.

loans.name: Balakhan

texts.en: Balakhan is married and lives with his wife and four children in Agsu, a province of Azerbaijan. His wife does the household chores and takes care of their children. In 2005, Balakhan decided to open a home goods store. When he started operating his business, he had much less working capital than he does now, after years of successful operation. Balakhan's trading business has grown thanks to his first loan with AqroInvest in 2010. He has a good loan history. Nowadays his monthly income is around 250 AZN. After successfully repaying his previous loans, he has requested a fourth loan in the amount of 1500 AZN to provide working capital to purchase more merchandise. Balakhan and his family are very thankful to AqroInvest and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renovate his store and expand his inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stock for his electrical goods store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy inventory for store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stock for his fruits and vegetables store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional foodstuff.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock store with various items.

loans.name: Cristobal Alfides

texts.es:
El señor Cristóbal tiene 58 años de edad, es casado con cinco hijos, pero solo uno vive con él.   

Él se dedica a prestar sus servicios como albañil, ya tiene más de 30 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, fueron unos amigos quienes le enseñaron. Además él junto con su esposa tiene un negocio de venta de plásticos desde hace 6 años. Su inventario es de 10 docenas de platos pachos, 5 docenas de platos soperos, 10 docenas de huacales de diferentes tamaños, 2 docenas de mascones para lavar platos, 1 docena de coladores de aluminio, 2 docenas de toallas para usar en la cocina y 2 docenas de manteles.

Esta mercancía las compra en una ciudad del oriente del país, que se encuentra a 27 kilómetros de la ciudad donde vive él, ahí encuentra los plásticos a mejor precio. Cristóbal solicita el préstamo a Fundación Campo para comprar 1 docena de rayadores plásticos, 6 docenas de escobas, 6 docenas de mascones de alambre, 6 docenas de coladores, 6 docenas de cucharones de teflón, 6 docenas de cubiertos, 6 docenas de platos de zinc, 6 docenas de cantaros, 20 botellas y cambiarle las llantas a su vehiculo y hacerle otras arreglos.

 De esta manera Cristóbal, incrementara su inventario y diversificara sus productos, por lo que ofrecerá más a sus clientes y satisfará la demanda existente, además que tendrá su vehiculo en buen estado.

De los ingresos que reciba, producto de la venta en su negocio, tiene pensado ahorrar para comprar un terreno y construir una casa, ya que donde viven es alquilada.
texts.en:
Cristobal, 58, is married with 5 children, but only one lives with him. He has worked as a mason for more than 30 years, and learned the trade from some friends. Together with his wife, he also opened a business 6 years ago selling plastic goods. His inventory is 10 dozen flat-brimmed plates, 5 dozen soup bowls, 10 dozen crates of various sizes, 2 dozen steel wool sponges for washing dishes, 1 dozen aluminum colanders, 2 dozen kitchen towels and 2 dozen tablecloths. He buys his merchandise in a city in the eastern part of the country, which is 27 kilometers from where he lives. He finds the plastic goods at a better price there.

Cristobal asks Fundacion Campo for a loan to buy 1 dozen plastic graters, 6 dozen brooms, 6 dozen steel wool sponges, 6 dozen colanders, 6 dozen Teflon ladles, 6 dozen pieces of cutlery, 6 dozen tin plates, 6 dozen pitchers, 20 bottles and to change the tires and make other repairs to his vehicle.

This will help Cristobal to increase and diversify his inventory so that he can offer more to his customers and satisfy the current demand. He will also have his vehicle in good working condition. 

From the income that he makes as a result of the sales, he wants to save money in order to buy some land and build a house, since they currently live in a rental home.

loans.use: to buy 12 plastic graters, 6 dozen brooms, 6 dozen steel wool sponges, 6 dozen colanders, 6 dozen Teflon ladles, 6 dozen pieces of cutlery, 6 dozen tin plates, 6 dozen pitchers, 20 bottles y to change the tires on his vehicle and make other repairs.

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 34 years old, married and has three children.

Amer has owned a food market since 2003, selling soft drinks, juices, vegetables, cheese and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs; he has sufficient experience in this field. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

Amer decided to apply for a loan of $2000 in order to redecorate his market. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to redecorate his market.

loans.name: Tamer

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. he is 49 years old, married and a father to five children.

Tamer has been the owner of a cars workshop since 2000. He repairs all types of cars. He HAS sufficient experience in this field and has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. He has a good reputation and he is well-known in the surrounding areas.
